title: Disaster
review: The road has nothing to offer, no views and hardly any good shops. Don't waste your time trying to visit. Mall road is far better

title: Lovely Place
review: A must visit for trekkers and enthusiastic cyclists. Good to visit at any time of the day. Green, calm n quiet peaceful place to unwind and breath in some real fresh air which is missing in all big cities these days.

title: weekend trip
review: nice place for a morning or evening walk, but often too crowded. reasonably clean but too much crowd during holidays makes it dirty

title: follow the road!
review: Easy to walk, no denivelations, and beautiful points of view....Just follow the Camel's Back Road and admire the Himalaya under the snow...

title: Lovely views and a perfect walk
review: Mussoorie in itself is gorgeous, and the camels back road makes it even better. It has some amazing views and the walk is perfect. Take out 2-3 hours and definitely go on a stroll.

title: Great view. Wonderful walk
review: The Himalayan range in its snowy glory is easily accessible on a clear day. It is a wonderful and peaceful walk from the Mall road which is crowded and touristy.

title: Good walk
review: This road is free of the chaos of Mall Road and one can really enjoy the walk from Greens restaurant to the Library end. It is a good 4 to 5 km of walk so better wear comfortable shoes.

title: Amazing View From Here
review: Just Follow the road you'll find the amazing view of Hills. Feeled very relax after walking on the Camel's Back Road

title: Serene
review: The road offers a serene walk. The road offers good view and surroundings. Nevertheless, found it a bit overrated.

title: Nice lovely walk
review: We walked in this road many times just to locate the camel Rock.... We could see each and every hill as the hump of a camel but could not see the entire figure.   Then someone showed us the small rock collection that looked like a camel. It's nice

title: Must visit place
review: It was very good experience to visit camel back road. It's one of the best walk in my life. Its amazing experience to long walk with my wife.

title: The most idyllic walk in the hills
review: It is quite difficult to find another comparable option to Camelback road in terms of solitude, peace and calm and the most invigorating walk amidst spectacular views of  snow clad peaks and mountain trails. The 3 km walk from the mall on to this road is a wonderful 'must do' for avid walkers and nature lovers

title: Went for a walk
review: Nothing much to see, just a walk along with your friends and family will give you a relaxed time. It looks amazing during monsoon.

title: An OK Walk  - shame about the rubbish everywhere
review: Camel's back Road is really just another road in Mussoorie to stack hotels onto. There is no footpath so you walk in the middle of the road. There are some places with a nice view and it is much nicer than walking along the Mall Road!

title: Awesome  view
review: Must visit this place if you are a nature lover... The views are breath taking... You also can can have views of Himalaya

title: Peaceful street
review: A quiet and parallel rroad to Mall road. I think in historically Mall road was made for Britishers and Camel Back road for Indians.

title: You can get a view of ice caped mountain from this place and a good view of hill station.
review: We have visited this place in the early morning during mid of October. very good view and we could see the ice caped mountain far from this place. However if you have visited the Gun hill point, its not worth to come to see only this place in Mussourie

title: An okay place
review: This is a long stretch of road between Kulri bazaar and Library Chowk. Nothing much other than taking a walk. Usually you find newly married couple who visit Mussourie for their honeymoon walking hand in hand (lost in their own world) along this stretch of road.

title: Peaceful walk away from hustle bustle
review: This is a 2.5-3 km stretch runs parralel to mall road , start from somewhere mid way in mall road and end towards library end. I would advise to go for a walk in the morning or evening as it would be quiet and you can enjoy the view and just spend some quality time with your family and friends.

title: Quaint, off the beaten track...
review: We stayed on the Camel's Back road at the Hotel Filigree. Glad that we did. It is in sharp contrast to the hustle and bustle of the Mall Road. There are no shops on this stretch except for the ocassional tiny grocery stores. The length of the trek connects Mall Road on one side (lovely omelette centre) to the same Mall Road on the other (Library end) forming an outer ring road of sorts. The walk will see beautiful cottages and hotels from the British era on one side and the entire valley overlooking the Himalayas on the other. Midway through there is also the camel rock point where the locals will show you a natural rock formation on a hillock that looks EXACTLY like a camel! Don't pay those guys lurking around with telescopes stationed on the side of the road, your phone camera would be good enough to zoom in and take a look yourselves.

title: See the Camel
review: This place is has nothing unsual other than a rock formation in the shape of a camel. You need to look carefully to stop the rock formation and taddaaaa, you see a camel.

title: Mussoorie - Camel's Back Road
review: Quiet picturesque three kilometre walk, best done during the mid-Morning’s or mid-afternoon. Some parts of the walking path are uneven, so best be careful. Couple of institutions are maintaining some of the walkway and have cemented it. There is an only war cemetery from pre-independence, but was locked during my Sunday mid-morning walk. Not sure if there is any street lighting, but the municipality could provide that, there weren’t any signages, no dustbin, no markers. Mussoorie Municipality could do well taking care of their heritage sites which are right in the heart of town.

title: Walk down memory lane
review: It's a long walk but worth the view. We started from the library side went all the way till where it meets the bend near Green restaurant. The walk has quite a few points of interest. U could visit the Nirankari Ashram, the Graveyard which has quite a bit of history to it and the Camel Back point.

title: Feel home town . Beautiful place for walk
review: Camel back road very good for quite walk . Nearly the hawa gher . There is lots of hours for old people. Mall road also good for shopping . Very cold place. Nice for newlyweds honeymoon .  Nice people also . I took dinesh rana taxi also .very good service time to time .very helpful . I love this place and people ️️️️

title: Good view
review: Had taken a cycle on rent and took this road. Go for the views and a leisurely stroll. Not much traffic, but good scenery.

title: Mezmerizing, WOW
review: Excellent Location to Walk beside the Valley of mountain. Almost 3km of walk. excellent location. away from vehicles and buildings. you can go there any time of the day, but I suggest especially to be visited in morning. walk through fog.

title: WASTE OF TIME
review: Its a long walking to reach camel back .... the camel back road is just a road with some valley looks ... as per me , its waste of time and not worth going there ... rather than it enjoy some other points.

title: Understated Elegance
review: This 3 km ring road along the Mussorie hills is an understated beauty. Unlike Mall road, which is always full of tourists and thus have a lot of chaos, a walk down camles back road is a walk into the nature.

title: MYSTIC
review: Our Hotel was at Camel back only. And we had some long walk in morning and evening on this road. Though deeply wooded, yet because of many dwellings, traffic is always there.

title: Best thing to do in mussoorie
review: Morning walk.

title: Every Joggers Delight
review: a must for every jogger...view from all the corners are very different and beautiful...there are plenty of ashrams and historical points on the way...

title: Good to walk
review: This is one of the main attraction in mussoorie. Visit this place in morning time. View from this place is very good.

title: A good place for walk & weather
review: Had enjoyed a good round trip of camel back and Mall Road in the loving morning. Weather is good and so is walk except not so good roads. Overall enjoyed the place.

title: ideal for walking
review: this is ideal for people who like to walk in the lovely weather...unlike  the mall road this one is pretty secluded...pretty amazing...

title: Perfect for a morning walk/Cycling!
review: Rent a bicycle, or just go for a stroll — the camel’s back road is worth spending some time, especially if you’re travelling as a couple.

title: shape of mountain is in camel back shape
review: This is not a place to vist but rather it is a place to watch and admire. The shape of mountain is that of a camel back . Yes the camels back shape mountain and people actually going up and down there. we can enjoy the view by clicking some amazing pictures of the hills and take a walk down the lane. Travellers who visit this place would surely be coming again to this beautiful location. There is no price to witness the view which adds to this beauty. Overall the roads are just so clean and beautiful that you wish they dont come to an end but then you need to end the walk to reach some where . A must visit place in mussoorie just for walk and that camel shape view of the mountain..

title: Nice place to walk
review: One must visit camels back road to enjoy nature's walk and see some of the old bungalows of mussorie owned by famous people

title: Amazing Solitary walks
review: Loved the morning walks and the dew-filled pavements. The entire loop of Camel’s Back to Mall Road is perhaps 5 kms and you can witness the enormity of mountains along the way. Along the way, you cross the Cambridge Book store where Ruskin Bond makes an appearance for the fans every Saturday, Kalsang (famous for its oriental meals), and other iconic buildings of Mussoorie.

title: Amazing walk
review: Nicely maintained road , was a pleasure to walk. Amazing view during your stroll.

title: Beautiful walk in the hills
review: Starts from the Mall Road and ends near the Ashram. Beautiful walk in the hills, away from the rush of Mall Road.

title: For Nature Lovers
review: Camel's Back Road is paradise for nature lovers. It is one of the best places for a walk and to enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

title: Very good walk...
review: The camel back is best road to walk and I bet you would love the same.

title: Best for morning walk
review: I usually go for morning walks at camel’s back whenever I am in Mussoorie. The stretch is around 3 kms starting from almost starting of the  Mall Road & ends at green restaurant. The view is just breathtaking. On the way u may find some monkeys so u may carry a stick with u. There are two ashrams on the way so in early morning u can listen to their bajhans while walking. Overall I find this place to be the best for walks, totally in peace & serene for which ppl usually come to hill stations.

title: Many thanks to Nirankari Sant Samaj
review: If you want to stroll in a better part of Mussoorie, take Camel's Back Road, rather than Mall Road. Less crowded, way cleaner (thanks to excellent maintenance by the Nirankari Sant Samaj Ashram there), very nice views, no hawkers or Maggi Points. It is good both in the morning (when you might find local hunks jogging it's entire length) and in the evening (when tourist kids might tear down the road on their rented bicycles). A better part of Missourie. Go there.

title: Beautiful , peaceful road
review: I went for a morning walk on Camel back road. Enjoyed alot its view and peaceful pin drop silence in the morning.

title: Excellent place to find Peace
review: Camel back road is like cool stream near the wild Sea- Mall road. Camel Back road is like walking through the valleys. Those not interested in staying in crowded Mall road, can stay or take hotel in Camel back road. It is silent and great for morning or evening walk. There are lots of hotel on this road. But mind you all would be far from the Mall road probably 1 to 3 KM. One can take cycle from the Mall road and ride on this road for an hour. The rates would be 100 per hour. It is very well maintained by Sant Nirankari trust and the road has great view of Valley and Mountains and too clean unlike the Mall road. Worth a morning walk or visit.

title: Lovely walk through the hills
review: It is lovely place for a walk with hills on one side and the valley on the other. There isn't as much traffic as on Mall road. We walked around 3kms on this road, turned to Mall road a km after spotting the Camel Back point.

title: Nice place to cycle
review: Its a quiet road, with good view points and some lovely hotels. The turns on this road are quite sharp, one needs to be careful if you are driving

title: More for name
review: The road is visited just for nostalgic name. However, things have changed over the year, and we have more

title: A beautiful walk amidst clouds
review: The walk on Camel's Back Road in Mussoorie is an unforgettable experience. The road is an alternative to crowded Mall Road and is much longer.

title: Lovely winding road
review: A quiet and scenic winding camel back road is a delight for the one who likes to walk...although the so called Camel's back si just some stones arranged so as to look like a camel's back...it's plain cheating to extract money to have a look at came's back through telescope although just a walk on the road is gratifying...

title: Good road to walk
review: An excellent road to walk in the evenings with nice view of the hills. It is almost parallel to the Mall road but there are no shops and less traffic. Better to walk in the early evenings.

title: A nature walk to rejoice
review: A promenade in the evening/morning to rejoice the picturesque view of Mussoorie, the Queen of Mountains. The name is derived from the shape of the road like a camel's hump. It is not crowded and very peaceful. It is a 3km road that stretches from library road to mall road, facing the Lal tibba side of Mussoorie.

title: Beautiful walk
review: Absolutely loved doing this walk every day of the 5 days that i was in Mussoorie. While the rest of Mussoorie is flooded with cars, honking noises and people, this place feels absolutely divine. Each stop on this road is an excellent photo op with a breathtaking view and absolutely quiet and peaceful with very few people around..

title: Walk with Deepak Joshi, our Guide!
review: Best Walking experience as we enjoyed the scenic beauty of the Valley and Deepak explained to us the the Flora and Fauna of this region. There are places to relax enroute and one can take lots of pictures. It is a great alternate to The Mall Road as this Road is quiet and very less people (only locals).

title: Good walking Road
review: This road is serpentine and circuitous. We walked from Picture Palace  to  Gandhi Chowk or Library end of Mall Road. This was a 3 Kilometer walk. No traffic in morning. Quite and calm road. On one side, a hill and on the other, a deep valley. Cool breeze was  freshening us. While walking on the way we saw  camel shape rock. This road has been named after it. We also saw Sant Nirankari Ashram, and Seva Kunj of Kripalu Maharaj. A must see in mussoorie.

title: Camel Road
review: Very good view from a long walkable road. Perfect place for mountain biking. Breath taking view from bike. Kids enjoy the bike riding. Rs 200 was the rent for one hour of cycle with big tyre, and Rs. 100 for normal cycle.

title: Visit the place in the evening
review: I was staying in this area and had average hotel but the road is very good in the evening to walk and had fast food, although its double the charge you pay in any other location but still worth it. Interesting thing i found there baby trolly available for rent there so if you have small babies you get trolly with the little kid who will push your babies while you may take photograph eat foods and window shopping

title: Best Place For Cycling
review: Rented A Cycle From Mall Road, Mussoorie started cycling  from Gandhi chowk went Pass by camels back road till camels back view point was my best cycling experience of life.

title: Land of clouds
review: Very good view of mountains & valleys from the view points in this road. Clouds will embrace you here.

title: Eco friendly
review: Nice to have a 4 km walk on this picturesque road,no pollution,clean road.. Valley view scenes..Nice experience

title: Average place, can be skipped
review: We went with an expectation to see some natural formation of camel's back. It is just an average place.  You have to either go walking or take a cycle rickshaw. For walking, it is bit too long.

title: best place for morning walk
review: Everytime i visit mussoorie, a morning walk to camel's back road is must for me. Beautiful surrounding and full of nature. One may take cycle rickshaw ride or horse ride during day time.

title: Just walk here
review: One of the best places in the country for morning/evening walks. Perfect place to soak in the natural beauty and pleasant weather of Mussoorie. Its 3 kms. According to me, Mussoorie is overrated as far as sightseeing is concerned - Its not at par with hill stations like Nainital, Manali, Ooty etc The real charm of Mussoorie is in walking around soaking in the greenery and weather. Camel's back road is the perfect place for doing just that.

title: Best place to visit
review: We went to this place on a cycle rickshaw on a reasonably cooler afternoon. Its a superb place for visiting along with family. The way its structured & the scenery that you get to see from the top makes you feel like visiting again

title: Calm and long, nothing else
review: This is a road that takes you to the Camel's back point. Now from that point, you can see Lal Tibba, Lover's Point, Old Mussoorie, Camel's back (shaped by stones) all via a telescope. So the end result is not so good. But only good thing is the calm and peace on that road, which will make a good walk. On the way has couple of view points and also a famous Gurudwara. Overall  its pretty average, if you are not so much in the mood of walk, you can find many places with calm and peace.

title: Far from the maddening crowd
review: An oasis of calm in midst of jam packed Mussoorie. Just go for a walk there & you will see a side of Mussoorie which is far removed from the hordes of tourists. Very quite & peaceful.

title: A walk to remember
review: The stretch can be covered on foot at any time of the day. However, morning walk with sunrise is the best time to be here.

title: The camel "rock" is actually disappointing
review: The walk was good and green to start with. We even got amazing fresh ginger lemon tea at the Telescopic View Point (Quiet Corner Café). Thereafter, it just went downhill (not literally though). There were monkeys everywhere, no place to sit, stray dog following us, and hardly anything extra scenic. To make it to the nearest good café (Llama café) we still had to talk an extra 10-15 min through the market. Beyond exhausted when we entered. The other option is cycle rickshaw but they charge Rs. 260 for a round fare (2 persons) so for 4 people works out pretty steep. Mussoorie is commercial and overpriced at every step. Horrible experience and not recommended with children especially for walking. Don't know about cycle/rickshaw.

title: Beautiful walk with a view
review: This walk in a must do thing when in mussoorie. Away from the the crazy crowd. Very peaceful with a great view of the Himalayas

title: Interesting walk
review: The Camelback is the main road of Mussoorie and it serves as the place walk in evening & enjoy the weather Mussoorie offers

title: Lovely walk in lap of nature
review: A must do .The walk is fairly level with gentle slope.Scenic views are breathtaking .One can walk at any time of day.

title: 3.5+ KMs long from barrier to ambedkar statue
review: Just to set things right, this is a long walk and late in the evening the road can get very lonely. So either walk during the day. And if you are not a big walker or have kids with you take a cycle rickshaw. There aren't much shops or anything as this is in the backside of the mall road (or parallel). Parts of the walk is through the village. That said the walk is scenic and quiet unlike the mall road. There is little to see around and I would say, you wont miss much if you skip this.

title: One can have a walk....
review: One can have a walk along the road with Picturesque spots. Its exactly aligned to Mall Road. Called Camel Road because on the way you will find a spot on a mountain where in a camel is being created by stones.

title: Peace
review: All that you search when you visit a hill station is peace and sanctity..which available at camels back road...such a beautiful walk beside the valley..with snow capped mountains.

title: Peaceful walk almost inside of mussoorie
review: Must walk on this road if you are in mussoorie

title: I think it is better the mall road
review: One of the very few places where I want to be, no rush peaceful place . You can go by walk and bike as well. A beautiful peaceful walk under the nature will always boost calmness and inner peace. Camel Back Road provides the same experience in Mussoorie. This 3 km long road is named as Camel Back Rd due to the presence of natural layout of rocks shaped like a camels hump at the end of road.

title: Nice ride off Mall road
review: Hire a bike and drive along the camel back road and enjoy the scenic beauty. Its less crowded so you can enjoy some quiet time. Absolutely recommended.

title: A quaint and peaceful road for your morning walks
review: Being a localite to Mussoorie i can swear by thr charm of this place, although just a road but the scenic beauty that you witness while walking or cycling on this road is just out of this world. This was our morning walk road when i was in school and 10 years later it is still my favourite place to be in Mussoorie.

title: Good for walk
review: Camel's back road is inside the city only. This place is famous for a walk. It is full of good view. You gonna love this place but beware of monkeys.  You can click good photographs. Really good for a nature lover.

title: Nice place
review: This is nice place to visit. Rented cycles/scooters are available on the mall road. This road has great view. Good for taking pictures.

title: Best view, fresh air,great long walk
review: This is Mussoories best place for Mountain view,valley view in my opinion.You should prefer walk over rickshaw as it's worth a walk & you can spend quality time with your partner or family. Must visit

title: ☮️ Place
review: Nice place for morning walk with family. It's a peaceful place back side of mall road Mussoorie. There is a old Graveyard which is as old as British time. A Natural built CAMEL WITH ROCKS can be view that's why it's name as Camel Back Road

title: Peaceful road off Mall Road
review: Camel's Back Road is a narrow road off Mall Road in Mussoorie.  It does not have much traffic or activity and is decent for a 2-3 km warm. It is far better than walking on Mall Road.  It offers good views but does not compare with the peace and scenery in Landour.

title: Refreshing & Peaceful Walk
review: Good and Peaceful place, away from the crowd this walk through mountain side offers good view of valley , Shivalik Mountain range view of Himalayas. You should prefer walk over rickshaw as it's worth a walk & you can spend quality time with your partner or family. A beautiful peaceful walk under the nature will always boost calmness and inner peace. Camel Back Road provides the same experience in Mussoorie. This is 3 km long road named as Camel Back Rd due to the presence of natural layout of rocks shaped like a camels hump at the end of road. Must visit

title: Refreshing walk with gorgeous views
review: Camel back road is approximately a 3 km walk. I started walking from Cambridge book depot. It's a long, winding road with the hill on your left and stunning views of the valley and mountains on your right. There are small resting shelters about every 300 meters where you can sit down, sip some water and contemplate the vista before you. The road ends at the Library, which is one end of the Mall road.

title: Quiet Walk off the Main market
review: This road is quieter than the main market road. There are fewer stalls and one can get away from the hustle of the main street. The air is fresh and the views of the valley are very picturesque.

title: Rickshaw is the only way to travel
review: The main mode of travel is cycle rikshaw and believe me it is expensive compare to other places in India.

title: Just nice
review: This place is only 900 steps from Green Chowk and 1.5km from Library Chowk you will find a small group of Shops next to Mussoorie School with Telescope to show you places like LOVER POINT opposite of shop or back top you will find the Camel Sitting on Rocks made from Rock Naturally. It's worth it.  Guys carry your DSLR CAMERA

title: Morning Walk!
review: It is a quiet and invigorating 25 minutes morning walk. Good views and there is a place to sit and rest. It is almost level walking space.

title: For a lazy walk
review: Do not miss a lazy walk at the Camel's Back Road when you will be at mussoorie. At a clear sky it will be an awesome experience in the lap of the hills.

title: Camel's Back Road
review: Good place that can be visited while you are in Mussorie . Away from the crowd this walk through mountain side offers good view of valley , Shivalik Mountain range view of Himalayas and refreshing. A few meters away after entering  Mall road check post point ,one can take a left towards Camel's Back Road .This road is about 2.5 kms and other end of this road meets other end of  Mall road ( close to Ruskin Bond book shop ) . Hawa and Mahal view point and a  rock formation in the shape of a camel are  the main attractions . Tourist vehicles are not allowed in this area .

title: A walker's delight
review: Delightful walk among greenery.The nature's touch is beautiful as you refresh yourself on this beautiful stroll.

title: Just good for a walk
review: This place is just a lonely road good for a morning / evening walk nothing else. Not a tourist spot definitely

title: Best walk of my life :)
review: You have to go here if you are in Mussoorie! The best 3km walk with amazing view and perfect weather in May evening, It is peaceful place with benches at some distance for you to sit and enjoy the peace and view it offers. Perfect place to see the sunrise with the sound of birds chirping.

title: Serene and Peaceful
review: The Camel's Back Road is one which is serene, peaceful and quiet, where one can actually just enjoy the features of a hill-station. It is much quieter and pleasanter than the busy Mall Road. A walk is definitely recommended, whether an evening or morning one both are equally enjoyable.

title: It's a quiet walk beneath tall trees.
review: Take a leisurely walk on this road. There are no gradients. It's meant to meander, stop, appreciate the snow covered mountains on the horizons and smile. Enjoy !

title: Nice walk around place.
review: It's very near from mall road.Go by foot and enjoy the nature.

title: I visited here coz of our gorgeous hotel pacific
review: Camel back's road is famous for two things i guess!

title: Serenity
review: Calm and serene place. Ideal for a stroll, preferably early morning during sunrise. There are a lot of activities on the Camel's back road. Dont forget to ask a local resident about the Camel's back rock. It is a natural wonder.

title: for a peace walk with your loved once
review: Amazing view, one can choose this for a peaceful walk alongwith your loved once while praising beauty of place.

title: Walks around Mussoorie
review: Best way to understand a hill station is by walks , keeps you healthy and best to enjoy the weather and environment.

title: Walk along camels back road
review: It's one of the most scenic walks in Mussourie. Must do during early mornings or before sunset. The road is well maintained. One can hire bicycles or even drive through cycle rickshaw

title: LOVELY ...
review: fresh , clean air,.... good for yoga and morning walk.. beautiful landscape., a hot cup of tea.. really makes and rejuvenate yr time at queens of hills.

title: U see camel rock from far away through telescope
review: Nice serene place,  but the camel rock can only be seen with binocular..  Nothing much to see,  except a camel shaped Hill.

title: Peaceful Walk
review: The place is beautiful for a walk in the morning or early evening, love walking in the peaceful nature

title: Nice long walk with very little activity
review: Totally opposite of busy mall road.... quite & scenic. Good for a long walk. No activity except seeing the camel shaped formation up the cliff.

title: Great place to walk aroung
review: Camel's back is a street that connects with the mall road at one end. early morning walk in this area is a must. The beautiful garhwal mountain ranges are visible around with the chirping of the birds.

title: Nice place!!!
review: The place was very beautiful and it's a good place to walk in the camels back road. The hill view was excellent. The photography view was also good.

title: Wonderful quiet road
review: Wonderful walk! if you are looking fora trafffic free road to enjoy a beautiful scenic walk..this is it..

title: camels back road
review: camels back road connects the two enda of the mall road kulri bazar and gandhi chowk it is mostly used by locals and tourists for early morning walks .Youcan see the himalyan peeks in full glory from here .THIS road is good for horse ridind and you can see people of all ages enjoying the ride from here you can see the camel hill which is a natural thing

title: It’s for the peace that you come here!
review: Mesmerising & breathtaking, walking early morning in North Mussoorie 3 Kms misty road with multiple view points - the major factor for consider is the time- early clear mornings and the least crowded days.

title: Camels back
review: Coming to mussoorie and not taking a walk at the camels back at the wee hours of the sun rise is really a fun especially in summer season. Worth walking as neither there is traffic nor pollution

title: Beautiful views. Nice walk to the place
review: Must try for tourists. Walk to the place and go there during day time ... stop over along the walk for sum Maggie and chai shops..

title: Excellent location for a walk. Must go for walk in early morning.
review: Go for walk in early morning or you can try cycling on camel back road. Cycle can be easily rented 100 rupee per hour from Ambedkar chowk. Fresh air with memorising views.

title: Interesting
review: You can view some of the high altitude points from telescope here. And off-course the natural rock camel by which the place is named.

title: Deceptive name
review: I started my walk with on camel's back road with much enthusiasm having a hope to view something as name suggests. But I was totally disappointed. Nothing like camel back can be seen on the whole stretch. Otherwise it was a pleasant walk along with good view of nature. One can really enjoy a long walk here on this road as the place is calm and beautiful with fresh air.

title: When In Mussooire Walk Here BUT. .
review: If at all possible avoid the attempt to get to Mussooire on a Holiday or most  weekends. Horrible traffic all the way up and almost as bad early pm coming down.  The walk along the north side of Mussooire takes you from the Library (West ) side over to Crystal Palace (East ) side. Depending on several factors you can easily do the walk in 30 - 40 minutes but in clear sky's you will see the Himalayan Mountains so you will want to consume that view and that of the valley below.  On a good day there can be zero traffic except few humans. There is a big difference in what you will hear (or  not hear) and see from the Mall Road South side and the Camelback Road. When in Mussooire this walk is always on my list, unfortunately today's Holiday made for a never again poor timing mistake. The Camels Back walk eased the 'pain' of the journey UP.

title: Enjoy an awesone walk in the lap of Himalayas
review: Tourists prefer to walk on this road which is shaped like a camel back. This is a destination of morning and evening walk. The road is roughly 3.5 Kilometres and it is a great experience to enjoy the walk here watching the Pahari culture, houses, cottages, greenery and enjoy freshness in the air.

title: One Camel standing in a distance
review: It is a mountain shapes like a back of camel. In between mountains and mist n fog it seems one camel is standing. On your go it is referred as a view point but u can give it a miss if u have hectic schedule.

title: OK
review: Its parralel road running on another side of Mall road of Mussorie but not so crowded & can view valley from there

title: A picturesque walking trail
review: It is a picturesque walking trail streched for about 3 KMs. You can enjoy a pleasant nature walk escaping the crowd of Mussoorie. The best time to visit is in the morning during sunrise. You will be amazed by the breathtaking view of the hills and if the sky is clear, then Himalayan ranges also. There are multiple viewpoints along the path. But you should be prepared for the long walk. Best for the nature lovers and photographers.

title: Great views
review: We loved this road. It is not so hectic as Mall road and great views. Best place in Mussoorie for sure.

title: just awesome
review: really it deserve no. 1 things to do in mussoorie. a long walk early morning was great. we enjoyed much. a must visit place. you can take a cycle on rent

title: Visit Camel Back
review: Visit Camel back only if u can walk long i.e. 45 mins one way to reach middle of the road for scenic beauty.

title: Scenic views but explore only on a clear day , avoid during misty times
review: Its a lovely walk along Camels Back Road - approx 3 Kms  offering scenic views all along, with Camels Back being the highlight. But explore only on a clear day else  no visibility during misty times

title: Not worth visiting.
review: There is nothing worth seeing at this place. There is a person with a small telescope. He shows a rock which looks like a camel on a hill side. Do not waste your time visiting this road. There are no interesting shops here.

title: Nature lover
review: Nice location and a good place for visitors to have a glimpse of nature. Free from noise and traffic.

title: Disappointed by the place
review: In the month of September we went. How were the view was covered with the clouds. It is just adjacent to Mall Road. Might be in some other time of the year the view and the walk around place is good.

title: Nice walk all along Camel back road
review: This a good place to spend time outdoor. We took rickshaw on our way to gun hill, while returning we came by walk all along camel back road enjoying the valley and the street shop spread across the side of the road.

title: Beautiful view
review: Nice place for an outing with friends and family. Beautiful mesmerizing view of Mussoorie hills covered with clouds. A must visit spot.

title: Good for Morning Walk
review: I visited this road in the morning. The atmosphere on the road was wonderful. There is Hawa Mahal Point, which gives a good scenes for photo shoot. If you are lucky, you can see snow clad mountain peaks from telescope here. Maggi and other refreshments are also provided here. You can enjoy food in Nirankari canteen in between, although it was closed in the morning hours. A building named Seva Kunj was also there on the way. There is a way near Hotel Sheela where you can cut short your walk and come directly to the Mall road instead of going up to Picture Palace.

title: Colonial charm at its best
review: A walk down this road till the Kulri area and getting back to the Library via the Mall Road is like a walk down the other world. Especially if the day is misty and clouds loom large in the horizon you are well into the mental realm of the bygone days as embodied in Ruskin Bond's stories.

title: Peaceful Picturesque walk
review: Its a beautiful romantic, peaceful Picturesque walk with not much of crowd and traffic. It is good for those who love nature and walk. We did not see youngsters there. Very few people, generally middle aged couples in romantic mood walking with hands in hand, occasionally stopping for taking pics. The natural beauty is so mesmerizing that almost all couples  tend to hug their partners closely and open display of affections. I loved it. For me it was with my wife on 28th wedding anniversary. We loved it.

title: Great
review: This was great and we had a lot of fun. We enjoyed ourselves very much and this was great. Thanks again for a great time we will definitely be back again in the near future and enjoy the hospitality. Thanks again.

title: Good Sight
review: Offering a beautiful view of sunset,sunrise and snow capped mountains,the roads is ideally used by locals for carrying out mornings and evenings walks.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to roam can do window shopping.Its near to The mall road but it's all very crowded so keep your self safe or you may be hit by a scooter or something overall good experience.

title: Nyc ride
review: It's a one time ride. Misty lanes of moussorie. Its enjoyable, can take a rickshaw or even hire cycle.

title: MAKING A STROLL HERE IS SOOTHING
review: This road is in close proximity to the Mall in Shimla and offers the tourists a serene place to walk along relishing the delectable greenery and view of the amazing Mussorie hills around.The place is neat and relatively plain making it a great walking treack away from the hustlke bustle of the Mall Road and places around.Tourists walk down this road after their shopping at the Mall to enjoy nNature and the sorroundings.

title: A walker's paradize
review: If you enjoy walking then this is a must do. Just be careful of monkeys, some of them get aggressive!

title: Nice place for romantic walks
review: Very nice quiet area for long walks and enjoying clouds all around. For all nature lovers and romantic people.

title: Just a road
review: It is just a road besides the mall road in mussorrie.It was generally less crowded than the mall road.It was a good palce to visit and have some walk with you love one.

title: great
review: good road for morning walk or rainy day. you can take a cycle from mall road 100 rs per hour. i liked this road with greenery and cleanness

title: Super place early mornings
review: This is the place which should be used for early morning walks and runs !

title: A walk
review: Almost every hill station now has a camel's back road from where you can see a mountain resembling the hump of a camel. But the weather of mussoorie makes this place lot different. A walk through the camel's back road would leave u mesmerized

title: Nice Stroll here
review: The way to this road is from the mall road. A walk in the morning hours here is the rewarding one. The views were quite eye-catching here.

title: good for walk
review: good place for shopping and eating. can satisfy taste buds with different kind of foods. nice place to hangout

title: Early morning walk
review: Good for an early morning walk since it runs for 2-3 km and is very flat comparatively. Misty as well.

title: Long and boring walk.
review: Its a long and boring walk with nothing to do. It was quite deserted and there was no public transport available easily o get you out of your misery in case you have completed half the walk. Avoid.

title: Famous spot
review: A perfect way to walk around nature.  we can see sunrise and sunset from this road easily. It is little bit crowdy in morning and evening. As the name signifies it has a natural rock formation which looks like a camel back with a hump. Overall nice place

title: Awsome view
review: It was gud to be there nice view and nice place to see it actually looks like a camel back one must visit at least once.

title: A calm and serene walk
review: It is always a pleasure to walk through the Camel back road in Mussourie and if it is drizzling, then it adds to the charm with clouds coming to meet you

title: Excellent place for morning walk.
review: Nice views. The camel's back can be viewed only from a particular point. When you walk from the mall road,before you reach the cemetery,there is a pole on the right side on which there is a board mentioning camel's back view. You will not get the view at any other point.

title: Awesome walk
review: Do a evening or a morning walk with friends and family... nice place and lots to look for neat and clean place

title: Average place
review: It is nothing but just a road in the town. So, nothing special with Camel's Back Road. Anyone visit Musoorie can see this road.

title: Easy stroll, great views.
review: This is a pleasant walk round the countryside. The views a across the hills are beautiful. You can stop and rest at several viewing points along the way. It is mostly flat making it an easy walk at a pace which is comfortable. There are one or two places to buy water so best to bring your own. A lovely way to spend the morning.

title: theres nothing here
review: Its just a road with bumps, unclean and not maintained. Dont think that it is an attraction to visit et al

title: A long walk ahead
review: Its just a road which provides you good view of the surrounding mountains. There is nothing else on that road. However, if you want a break from the maddening crowd on the mall road then you can take a walk here.

title: Nice way
review: If u r really like cycling then you must visit this road in Mussoorie.

title: Excellent view
review: Excellent view from our hotel at camel's back road, you can give it a shot if you too don't like a over crowded mall road.

title: Nice View ,Romantic Place
review: One should choose hotels on camel back road as mall road is on walking distance and it is peacful,do not go for hotels on mall road as it is very crowdy.

title: Noisy road filled with tourists
review: Terrible place. Cars everywhere  honking  at you when u try to walk. Best avoided completely. The presence  of an ashram has made this completely busy and trafficky.

title: Morning troll
review: Had a morning walk on the road which has great scenic view of the hills. few good hotels were on the road.

title: 'Tranquility Finally '
review: If in Mussoorie, the town is good enough for a stroll. A tranquil walk desired? It's right there for you, well within the town precincts as well. The Camel's back road, as it's known.  A perfect place for an exhilarating walk in the mountains, overlooking the snow capped Greater Himalayas out yonder. A must for walkers and those who happen to be fond of cycling.  The cycles can easily be hired out from numerous outlets as you enter the Mall Road.  To rest your weary legs,  take a respite at the Nirankari Bhavan's canteen, where you can indulge in reasonably good tea and coffee, along with numerous snacks available there.  Just ahead is a wooded area besides the cemetery, which adds to the aura.  A ' must Visit ' area of charming Mussoorie.

title: TERRIBLE
review: Stinking an neglected state of a famous road made us feel sorry and discontinued our walk immediately.

title: Scenic
review: Had morning walks on this road. The fresh air could be felt and the scenic beauty was great. Away from city hustle bustle one must go here!

title: Nice road for morning walk
review: This is a nice and peaceful road with a great view of valley. You can leisurely stroll on this road and can sit to enjoy view of beautiful valley.

title: Walking Camel's Back Road
review: Very dirty, not at all enjoyable. Can be easily skipped. However, if you do stay in Mussorie, can take an evening walk.

title: Nice Walk In Nature
review: This is the best place while staying in Mussorie

title: Lap of nature
review: If you are a nature lover and looking for some me time for your self and want to connect with  Mother Nature this road is the place where you should visit . Must visit road go n meet your self .

title: Nice for walks and nature
review: Enjoyed walking and hiking on camel's back road on my last trip of Uttarakhand. Quiet and peaceful place away from the hustle bustle.

title: Perfect for a walk.
review: The road takes you on a circuitous route around Dehradun. Lovely views of the surrounding hills. Perfect for a queit walk early morning or evening.

title: Morning Walk
review: Recommended for Morning Walk before 8 AM.A nice walk of 3 Km  will refresh you.Although it going more crowded but still best place for morning Walk.

title: Vacation
review: Extremely crowded .

title: Nice view
review: It was a very nice and pleasant view there. Thanks to guruji travels to make my trip memorable. It was very comfortable. Guruji is best transportation service in Delhi.

title: Away from the maddening crowds.
review: A beautiful walk with scenic views; a nice place to jog if in the mood & a few short-cuts to other places of interest.

title: Nice walk
review: It is a nice walk with wonderful view to cherish forever. Lovely houses and mighty peaks to look at.

title: Nice Walk
review: Nice place to walk down to enjoy the scenic beauty of the place and enjoy the nature.The road gets its name from a rocky formation on the hill that resembles a camel.

title: Ideal for long walks
review: This is the ideal place for a long walk away from the hustle and bustle of the Mall. It takes half an hour to walk at a comfortable pace from the entry point near the Library to the exit near the old Kwality's restaurant. Of course, if would take much longer if you choose to rest on any of benches dotting this road, or step into the old cemetery which lies beside this road.

title: Morning walk with a view
review: If you stay in  Mussorie, then morning walk on camel back road is recommended. Pleasant morning walk with beautiful valley view with sun rise is breathtaking experience. End your walk with refreshing lemon honey tea.

title: OH MY GOD .....what a beautiful road....
review: What a place....real jewel of mussorie....a breathtaking walk of 3 km will give you a spiritual experience...traffic is very less at this road...this road starts from near library chowk and ends on near picture palace..camel back road runs parallel to the mall road..this is the no 1tourist spot of mussorie..must visit place...

title: Nice and Peaceful....
review: This road is a peaceful place in Mussoorie a bit far away from the crowd at the Mall Road. A walk on this road at early morning or during sunset makes U feel quite good. There is an old British Cemetery too on this road...There is ample lighting throughout this road.An ideal place for peaceful walks..

title: Too much of a hype
review: I didn't understand what was the idea for even mentioning this road for visit. Just a normal road may be with some views of the mountain / valleys.

title: Peaceful walk in Mussoorie
review: The Camels back road is like a balcony of the Mall Road, winding down from one end of the Mall to the other over a 3 kilometre distance.

title: Camels back no more
review: No more the camel back it was known for. Totally commercialized,  packed with parked cars, No more serene and tranquil add it was. No point talking a leisure walk! The authorities have let down the beautiful hill station!

title: nice for walks
review: This was a nice place to walk in the morning and evenings.  beautiful view and nice road.. you can spend 2-3 hours easily here.

title: Perfect getaway for a stroll
review: Its a perfect get away for an early morning or evening walk.  Being on valley side one can get superb awesome views of himalayan prakar subject to weather conditions.  Irrespective of the weather conditions experience of walking there is unparalleled.  Strongly recommended

title: Good for a walk
review: Want to enjoy your morning walk with scenic beauty, go to camel back road. You can also hire a mule.

title: Good walkway
review: Interesting road to walk and admire the British raj structures and the view of gun hill,  and Ddon valley as the road is famous in Mussoorie.

title: Walk through the fog!
review: It was beautiful to walk along this road. It was quiet foggy and you walk through the fog! It is lovely and exciting! You can crab corns on your way and have a happy munching walk! :)

title: Good for a romantic walk
review: Camel's back road is a good place to have a long walk. I enjoyed walking here with a lovely view of sunset and valley. One can also hire Bicycles and go for a ride which you get for Rs 100/hr.

title: beautiful serene walk
review: This is a long quiet walking track with minimum incline. It is well lit up. It starts near Ritz cinema and ends at the other end of the mall.

title: Walk with nature!!!
review: I recently visited Mussoorie in May 17. I took a walk early in the morning on camelback Road. I recommend everybody who is visiting Mussoorie to take out some time for morning walk alongside nature by having a magnificent view of hills and valleys which gives you pleasant and soothing experience alongwith fresh and healthy air.

title: Romantic but Long Walk
review: This is the least crowded road in Mussoorie. Its a 3 km long road parallel to the mall road but at the different side of hill. It starts near Aggarwal's at the Picture Palace side and ends near the Library Chowk. There are 2-3 huts to halt during the journey. There is no shop on the road, so better to carry your own food and drink items. This road offers some great views and a peaceful walk.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: Nature in its full glory, beautiful landscapes dotted with cute cottages, photographer's delight!! Ten minutes walk from the famous Mall Road..

title: Road shaped like a Camel's Back around the hill
review: The mall road in the center of the all activities in Mussoorie it stretches from the Library end to the Picture Palace end around 2.5kms. The camel back road winds around this hill on the eastern side like a balcony into the deep valley with fantastic view. Stretches more than 3kms. We took a walk in the evening from one end to the other our hotel being near the Library end of The Mall Road.

title: Esay and the best walking trail
review: The best thing about Camel's back road is that you will see few tourists venturing on this road. While the Mall road in season is jam packed with tourists this scenic raod, just behind the mall road is almost deserted. The gradient is level and you can walk at a lesiurely pace enjoying the scenic views. There are hawa ghars at regular intervals where you can take rest. You also have people with telescope on this road where for a small fee you can see the snow laden Himalayan peak. The raod gets its name from a rocky formation on the hill that resembles a camel. The Mussoorie cemetry where some of the earlier pioneers have been buried ( John Lan, Pahari Wilson) lies on this road.

title: Camel's Back Road
review: It is just a road for stroll on the back of mall road. A person with a telescope showed us why it is named so. Over the hill you can see a formation of rocks like a camel with its prominent back hump. With the same telescope you can see other places like Nagdevata temple, Lal Tibba, Lover's point, Sachin Tendulkar's summer resort , a village in the valley etc.

title: Morning  Paradise!
review: Get up, brush,  put on shoes and leave for a walk. Amazing! If one gets tired there  are spots in between  to rest.  And the best  part one get  tea and biscuits on one of the relaxing spot.

title: Good long walk but weather in May is a no no
review: Good long walk of 3-4 km but in month of May with hot sun on your head its no much fun. This is the side of Mussoorie where we can see the famous Himalayan mountain ranges including Gangotri and Yamunotri.

title: NICE EVENING
review: It is one of the few place you can enjoy your evening in Mussoorie,

title: Nice walk
review: the walk on camels back road is relaxing and nice. try and go early morning as it is usually empty that time. later on it gets crowded

title: Nothing Great
review: This road is famous for its Camel Hump rocks formed on the mountain. It is just a normal feeling seeing it, it may be possible that you wont even find it, happened with me. The only good part about the road is the drive and the scenic beauty and the temperature is always 2-3 degree low than rest of mussoorie mall road or library end.

title: Most secnic walk
review: The road to see the Camels back was sooo beautiful. There was hardly anybody on the road therefore it was quiet and serene.

title: Lovely Walk
review: We spent a couple of days roaming on the Mall Road in Mussiorie, but once I got introduced to Camel Back Road, I fell in love with it. It's roughly a 4 km long road, covering the back of the town. Nice and cozy, nice views of the mountains, nice buildings here and there as you go. I'd recommend you enjoy this walk if you're in town :)

title: Camel back road- real peace
review: Mussoorrie's camel back road is real peace in entire Mussoorrie. One can experience scenic while walking this road.

title: Deepak Goradia - Beautiful Place
review: I am Deepak Goradia, I want share some my experience with you friends. This is very beautiful place in India. I recommended you to go.

title: Go for a walk here
review: great view which can be only enjoyed while taking a walk. Totally safe to even walk in night but best to explore early morning.

title: Beautiful !!!!!!!
review: The walk in the morning on the Camel's Back Road is just refreshing with nature's bounty all along the way. The fresh air and splendid views start your day on a good note.The morning bird calls are the music to the ears. A good walk for health and peace of mind.

title: Long walk on a lonely Road with beautiful scenery
review: Camel Back Road is approx. 3+ kms stretch starting from Dr. Ambedkar statue at the beginning of the Mall road, near Library / Gandhi chowk to the Green Hotel on the other end of the Mall Road. I would recommend, unless you are staying in hotels on that side of the city, you should take a walk on this road only before 8.00 am or after 4.30-5.00 pm in the evening. You get to see beautiful natural scenery and I saw lot of birds on my early morning walk. There is a cafe near Nirnkari Ashram, which is midway, where you can have refreshments, if interested. If you go in the evening, instead of coming back by the same route, you could spend the evening on the Mall Road, where lot of shoping and eating options are available. The 'Camel Back Rock' is not very impressive as you do not get to see it with naked eye due to obstructing trees. But the walk is a real good experience.

title: Great to walk and discover
review: The Camels back road begins from the Library end of the Mall Road and is a great place to go for walks.

title: What a beautiful place
review: If you've a cycle or can rent one somewhere on the mall road. This is the perfect place to go. You can walk or cycle, or just sit. During the monsoons , this place gets engulfed by clouds. You can get some great pictures to take back home z and have an experience of a lifetime

title: Beautiful scenery
review: This place is very good for morning walk. Beautiful valley view is there along the route. It's very quiet in the morning, so someone looking for calm can visit. There are few shops on the way where you can enjoy a cup of tea or Maggie.

title: Dont miss the walk
review: A beautiful walk on the back side of Mussoorie,  only occasional vehicles.  You can see and hear the Himalayan birds if you go for early morning walk.  You can also see the distant Himalayan peaks on a clear day.  Total distance of 2.5 km from one end to another.

title: Walk by the sides of scenic mountains
review: From Mall road you get view of Dehradoon city while just by the side of Mall road there is Camel's back road, from here you can get spectacular view of massive mountains. Nice place to just sit and stare at the mountains. :)

title: A spoilt walk
review: A great walk around Camel's Back road..once upon a time!! A beautiful walk marred by vehicles moving and half the road used for parking by the large number of hotels which have mushroomed along this scenic road.

title: Nice place to visit
review: We went there by cycle ricksha from mall road.  A person was there with big telescope.  He showed us few points one of them was Lal Tibba where one bigger telescope is installed which can be used to view Kedarnath, China border etc.  At the end of the show he showed us the main attraction which is camel's back.  This is a natural rock and from that particular angle it looks like a camel.

title: Calm and Beautiful views
review: I am regular visitor to Mussorie. Camels back is my favourite place for morning walk when ever I am in Mussorie. Apart from the crowd on mall road, it is very calm place with beautiful views and fresh air for nature lovers.

title: Must Visit for morning Walker's
review: Highly recommended for morning walkers and nature lovers. Not commercialize and near to nature. Less crowded. One must experience romantic. Walk with your beloved.

title: its quiet and serene
review: good for a morning walk,you get to see the green hills.....there are few restaurants,It has a colonial feel.

title: perfect morning walk
review: The best time to visit this place is in the morning. early morning. the view is picturesque and its peacefull. Little chilly but you will love the experience

title: Peaceful walk
review: Started the walk post lunch around evening, start was bit commercialized but later on this road is very peaceful and ha lot of trees around, it's well paced and good for morning or evening walks. There are some scenic spots if weather is clear.

title: breathtaking
review: I went to Mussoorie a number of times but never visited here. On my last trip to mussorie I walked alone to this place and had a regret of not visiting before . A purity in the environment along with the beautiful view of camelback hill. I would love to visit again.

title: "A quiet walk in midst of the bustling mall road'
review: We walked through this road during the noon time. It would have been the best place to walk either early morning or late evenings. But our luck though it was hot, the windy weather typical to hill stations gave the relief. A nice walk for about 1.5 kms and the view point location gave the full view of the valley. Its one of the must walk place of Mussorie.

title: Superb beauty
review: Walked the entire stretch of the road with my wife. Its a beautiful walk, very serene and scenic. Do not travel this road by car as you will miss out on the natural beauty. It joins back to mall road in the end.

title: Once worth for sightseeing but nothing great.
review: Need to go by cycle rickshaw, as the place is quite far and lot of up and down as its on the top of mountain

title: Camel rock road
review: It's a beautiful 3-4 kms stretch valley road leading to a camel shaped rock on a hillock in Mussori. We can see the camel rock from a certain point through telescope. The only problem is no proper transportation facility to go there. The uttarakhand tourism department should encourage electric or battery operated vehicles in Mussori to go to nearby places of tourist attractions. We feel a bit inconvenience to raid a cycle riksha..

title: Camel Back Road
review: It is a beautiful place to walk along the narrow roads passing by the hills. In addition, you would find some hawkers selling corns etc.

title: Quaint walks
review: A nice walk with quiet and refreshing surroundings. The views are amazing. Great for anyone looking for peace.

title: Hilly Road With Mountain View
review: Nice and clean road with most of the hotel located on it. Mesmerizing view of valley and glacier from this road only.

title: Nice place for a walk amidst mountains
review: Great place for a peaceful walk away from the city offering nice view of Garhwal range. It is very near Club Mahindra

title: Great walk along the shops!!!
review: It's a picturesque walk along the shops and valleys on either side.. The roads are scenic with beautiful views. Worth a walk.

title: dont go if short on time
review: there is nothing much there dont go if you are short on time and dont go on self driven card its really narrow road

title: If you prefer solitude!
review: Explore the 3km stretch rather than the 1km mall road. Don't we have enough people and shops in the cities? Take in fresh air and enjoy the views!

title: Good cycling experience
review: Good to walk or cycle during evening,has good scenic views. Can be explored walking or cycling or take a simple cycle rickshaws

title: Good for Trekking
review: This is a good place for mountain and nature lovers. We went for a trekking and it was fun. Would recommend all trekking lovers visiting Mussorie to go here.

title: Only for the outdoor lovers!
review: I would highly recommend trekking along the camel's back road for lovers of nature and trekkers. Splendid views of the mountain ranges and the surrounding scenery.

title: Nothing there
review: Nothing there. I don't know why is there so much hype. It's just a view of the mountain shaped as camel back.

title: nice place to walk around
review: camel back ek bas stone ka chota sa shape hai bas but aap camel back tak jaenge to Mussoorie valley ki khoobsurti ko ache se dekh paenge.

title: take a walk and be relaxed
review: its a nice place in mussoorie where you can spend your morning . start somewhere from the end of mall road and walk 2-3km by seeing the beauty . you can even see himalayas if the cloud is clear . walk straight and you will reach library chowk back . its like a circle. so no need to walk back the distance .

title: Camel's Back Road is pretty for morning walk/jog, but when it comes to evening, it is little lonely place.
review: Camel's Back Road is pretty for morning walk/jog, but when it comes to evening, it is little lonely place. Very pretty view of snow mountain. Peaceful place to be.

title: Mussoorie Back Road
review: Very good view in early morning..i feel relaxed when i go in early morning..Evening view is also good if your partner be with you..

title: A peaceful photo call
review: Enjoyed a beautiful clear day, when we walked along the Camel Back Road. A easy walk, from Library back to Library about 4 kilometres. Photo stops on the way of the snow covered Himalayas. Can be chilly, in March out of the sun, so a jacket is useful.

title: Quite Walk
review: This is a Road with a view and calmness. We went during non tourist season and enjoyed every bit od it. It has a point for view and walk is quite. But overall one can visit this place for experience of nature.

title: Normal
review: I had visited this place with my friends. Heard a lot about the camel's back road but there was nothing special. You can surely skip this place and visit some place else

title: Camels back - Surprised me to visit
review: Jan 2017 - i was in Mussorie, quite surprisingly no body could explain me what exactly is camels back? while some tourists did that but i could not relate.

title: Amazing ride to camels back road
review: The cycle journey to camels back road is more beautiful than the point..It offers splendid views of the mountains..

title: Total contrast to the hurly burly of the Mall
review: If you want some peach and quiet, head out on Camel's Back Road. The crowds are almost non-existant, the views great. Stop at a viewpoint for a cup of tea or coffee. Stare at the Himalayan peaks in the distance on a clear day. The experience is truly memorable.

title: Walk lovers...explore
review: See old Mussoorie , snow clad mountains...enjoyed best with binoculars Walk on & enjoy fresh oxygen...fill up your lungs...move on ...enjoy hot tea with noodles

title: A good walk
review: Good place to have a jog or walk for an hour. If you are travelling with your pet (say dog), it is worth it.

title: picturesque area
review: Camel back in mussorie is realy a most beautiful and picturesque area in the hills of mussourie, this place is good for walking in the hills, a paradise for the mornig walkers. Tis area is exactly back side of kurli in mussoorie. Good hotels and nirankaris asharam is on this road.

title: Rolling on Camel's back
review: Mesmrising experience of moring walk on Camel's back....... Truly amazing !! A must do thing for Mussoorie traveler.

title: Nice Place
review: Nice Place to go. Can be seen from mall road. A quiter and less busy place than the mall road as no shops are there here

title: Fun on Road
review: A beautiful peaceful walk under the nature. Views are amazing. Snacks are also available and shopping also.

title: Splendid sunset view..
review: I started the walk on Mall Road near Library chowk and branched off into the Camel's Back Road after about 200 meters. After walking away from the Mall Road for few more meters, it was a wow for me to experience such a quite and peaceful road, barring some odd 2 wheeler buzz; bang inside Mussoorie. Have been to Mussoorie several times in the past 30+ years, but never had walked on this nice road. Generally, Mall Road has been  the hangout place ,all the while. I imagine that this Camel Road would have been much more cleaner years ago, something I missed !!

title: A "Must Walk" Road with great views and little traffic
review: The Camel's Back Road branches out from the Mall Road from close the horse stand and connects with The Mall Road/Kulri at various points.

title: Congested, Meant for locals
review: The road is very narrow and congested with traffic. There are no major eateries here. Mainly local shops, banks etc are lined up. Not worth exploring unless you are headed for some place specific.

title: Lovely view of the purple headed mountains
review: I went for a evening wike(walk+hike) to witness orange sky against the never ending stretch of purple headed mountains. After dark, we headed to the Mall road to shop from the local carts and took a tonga ride back.

title: Beautiful
review: Camel Back Road is a 3 km long road famous for nature walk and Himalayan viewing in morning and evening.

title: Tranquility and fresh air
review: This is the best and most romantic section of Mussoorie. The road bifurcates from the economic hub Mall Road. Ideal for those morning walk or quiet evening walk.

title: Nostalic path....
review: Camel's back is a very peaceful, beautiful and nostalgic place in Mussoorie. Besides a fabulous walk, it has one of the oldest cemetery, which is more than 150 years old. The winding path has many beautiful look-outs.

title: Superb
review: Keep walking keep enjoying keep shopping...great road to eat and move around especially in winters ...

title: A pleasant walk way.
review: Interesting walkway to lot of street food stalls, flea market stalls.

title: fantastic walk
review: the camel's back road is named because from a particular point on this road, one can see a natural rock formation of a sitting came. and what a walk this, undoubtedly the best place for morning walks in mussoorie with almost no vehicles plying and the serene bountiful nature all around you.

title: Good view point from the road
review: It's the main road of the mussorie town surrendered with lots of good shops, cafes, restaurants and business points.

title: Nice walk!!!
review: The hill is in the shape of a Camel's back- that is where it gets its name from. A pleasant walk which takes you through some good food stalls and flea market. More enjoyable on foot rather than taking a rickshaw.

title: too much hyped
review: camel's back is OK, you can notice only from far . Road is good to walk but too long so unless you have lot of stamina avoid walking because finding transport for one side (only return) is tough here...

title: Good for morning walks
review: Nice picturesque views. Go early morning, you will get to see Himalayas peak with sunrise. Do not take any public transport.

title: Best to visit during Dec-Jan
review: The road looks the best when there is a little fog around ! Best time to visit is during early day time.

title: very nice
review: very beautiful road,we took a rickshaw and traveled the full stretch.The binoculars show you the camel like rock tophill absolutely clearly.

title: leisure walk
review: Its 4 kms stretch with beautiful view of himalaya and doon valley...in cool winter it pleasant to take walk...or cycle rickshaw ride... from mall road cycle rickshaw stand it cost 450 to cover muncipal garden, mall road and camel back road

title: Lovely walk
review: We got off our cycle rickshaw and walked along. The ubiquitous mountain road in a hill station, with great views all along.

title: Pleasant morning walk
review: Hi folks, if weather is clear, have a walk on Camel's back road during early morning hours i.e. 6-8am. Scenic beauty is amazing, Himalayan view is marvelous.

title: Scenic walk
review: Set amidst the hustle-bustle of Mussoorie town, Camel's back road is a nice long walk area to get away from traffic and people.

title: COOL AND CALM FOR WALKING
review: It was an after lunch family leisure walk for us, when we were discussing the reason behind such unique name Camel's Back. Gradual incline makes the road very comfortable for walking.

title: amazing place for a quite walk the mornig and evening
review: Good location to get away from the Mall road for a quite walk with or without your partner. cant not miss

title: nothing great
review: nothing great about this road, better walk on the mall road, or sit near the library chowk, and enjoy the doon valley view.

title: Nice  stroll
review: Just a beautiful stroll taking in the breathtaking views.  The place was very quiet when I was there and made for a lovely walk

title: Serene place for a walk
review: A high point of our trip to Mussoorie. It was a scenic walk. There are two rocks like a camel hump. But we went at dusk and it can get quite dark and lonely. There are a couple a shops where you can stop and have tea and Maggi

title: Amazing
review: The view was nice and since it was less cloudy , it was picturesque . Could catch a faint glimpse of Himalayan peaks and white shimmering glow though faint. Always prefer before 2 PM.

title: awsome
review: place isawsomr with a nature view and good envorment i love to visit this place every week end after my offfice trip

title: Fascinating place !!
review: Beautiful place to go for a scenic , peaceful walk. Road has great views of mountains and valley. Went for cycling in early morning , it was great experience. Youngsters in group  should go for cycle ride of full camel road . Best time for walking and cycling -Early morning and Evenings.

title: A lovely wark
review: Wonderful Views, Good Birding Opportunity, Road to Mall road and bit of trekking too. The place provides a wonderful opportunity to metro resident of an almost traffic and pollution free walk. On your way you can see a number of old world charm structures. If you are keen enough then you can spot a number of local birds and it is a treat. Some ashrams also on the route. The road has multiple exits and touches Mall Road. Climb can be a serious trek at some point. Also, a wonderful opportunity to view from telescope - various points including the Camel Rock.

title: a great walk and everyone's treck
review: a great walk and everyone's treck if you are visiting mmmusoorie. during the winters start a bit late in the day and enjoy the expertise camels back road offers a great walk with sunshine and fabulous views that you encounter on the way.  the views change with every turn you take. the trail will let you explore a very different side this hill town....other than the busy .mall road. highly recommended and totally rrejuvenating.

title: Great for a morning walk
review: The place is great for morning walks and jog if you like. Excellent view of the Himalayas... Most people do not mention but the road starts and ends at Mall Road of Mussoorie, so you may wanna take a detour and explore this road while strolling at the mall.

title: Wandering about
review: Pleasantly refreshing walk. Breathe in life. Green, serene, peaceful. Panoramic views of the mountains. Winter chill is exhilarating. Bliss

title: a must visit
review: the walk down the camels back road is truly amazing. a lot to look around and discover. hop on to a rickshaw.

title: Cool Camels Back road
review: Excellent place for a morning walk or rickshaw ride. You can enjoy the pure narture and cool breeze. nice views of valley. carry binocular to see camel back rock....

title: A fantastic morning walk - awesome
review: It's too good, have a walk in the morning (between 6am and 7:30am - less crowdy) -  you wouldn't regret.

title: Beautiful walk
review: If you want to walk on less crowded streets of Mussoorie, head for Camel's Back Road. A beautiful winding road with great views and less traffic. You can also see the snow-capped mountains from here on clear days.

title: Best Nature walk
review: Camel's back Road has a great view of the mountains and valley, much better and serene than the crowded Mall road.

title: The most scenic walking route.
review: This is one of the most scenic routes to go for a walk . The camels back hike is a hike without any inclines. It is very comfortable and you get wonderful views of the valley . Hike up to the hill view mount which is run by a grandma and Grandpa. The Grandpa will tell you about the history of mussoorie and will show you the famous peaks such as gangotri, yamunotri if the view is clear via his telescope. Drink some ginger tea, eat some maggi and you would be fine along the hiking path .

title: Nice Road
review: It's a very cool and calm road. Ideal for morning walk. You can see two rocks forms a camel's back if you see from a certain point on this road.

title: Quiet road
review: It is a very beautiful road away from crowd and noises with beautiful valley view.

title: Awsome View
review: If  you have luxury of time and you are a couple then its a must visit place. Travel early in the morning. Calmness and serenity of this place will mesmerize you.

title: beautiful nature walk
review: It is a very beautiful road away from crowd and noises with beautiful valley view.You can enjoy the pure nature and cool breeze. nice views of valley.

title: A great walk with friends harnessing amazing views
review: One of the must go places of the hill station. The best part is walking with enjoying in a very long path without any travelling facility. The views from there are amazing. Most of the good hotels are also there.

title: very very calm and serene track for wlaking
review: had a long walk as weather was good. no harsh sun. one can relax for sometime on benches provided on the walking trail.

title: The Mall road
review: walk down this road for an amazing experience of mussorie city. Filled with shops , restaurant, bars, gaming centers , local item shops, hotels etc

title: Beautiful misty walks
review: Good relaxing place for walks specially with mist all around. I wish we could spend more time here. Thanks for our hotel team for giving complimentary pickup drop to library area.

title: Beautiful place for walks
review: We went in the  starting of September and this place was not at-all crowded. You can enjoy peaceful long walks. One can rest on the benches provided.

title: A lovely walk in Mussoorie
review: Camel Bck road makes for a lovely, leisurely walk to get away from the hustle and bustle of mall road.

title: Mussourie vacation
review: Great for a long walk .About 4Km walk once you enter the road the views are great ,no traffic ,relaxed walk no restaurants except a tea stall .At the end you have a telescope run by a local shopkeeper who showed us all the sights.

title: Pleasant walk
review: Delightful easy walk of around 4 kms on one level around a ridge. Easy to find with a few directions from the locals. Lovely trees and outlook onto mountains. Due to time of year and cloud cover visibility was limited and did not get to see foothills of Himalayas as wanted. A must if you are staying near by.

title: Great view point with Himalay view
review: Relaxing walk along this road with a good view. In September end / Oct beginning the view of snow-capped peaks was not possible due to complete cloud cover. The owner of the shop there promised good view in end October-Novermber

title: beautiful view
review: by tracking on the camel,s back road you can enjoy nice hills and beautiful views, there is a lot of greenary also, there are some places where you can sit and enjoy all the beauty

title: Mesmerizing Walk!
review: If your in Mussoorie, and your not one of those cheap travelers looking at a cheap place to get drunk, sleep & drive down again the next morning, here is the place to be. You just cannot miss this walk while your in town!

title: Stunning
review: Took a rickshaw from gandhi chowk to reach camel back point. The views on the road to the destination point are absolutely stunning. There is so much of peace, no traffic. Best time to go is in the early morning hours or after 4:30 in the evening when cars are not allowed on mall road. If you not much fond of walking then will suggest to take rickshaw from gandhi chowk. They will charge 50 for each rider (one side). Distance  is around 2 to 3 kms from gandhi chowk. Once you reach camel back point, you can easily walk to the other end of mall road (near jhula ghar). Distance is only around 0.5 kms app. If you take shortcut (road along hotel nand regency). Don't miss camel back road if you are in mussoorie.

title: Camel Back Road
review: Camel back road is situated in mussoorie, its famous for its calmness and its environment for beautiful walk under the nature.

title: Divine experience
review: The most memorable experience of Mussoorie visit is the walk on this road. Takes about 2 hours. Very calm, no traffic, lush green, an amazing walk.

title: Amazing View
review: This is one the places that should be on top your list to visit if you are travelling to Mussorie. The view is amazing with lovely trees and fog all over makes it more awesome.

title: Roamantic Walk
review: A very beautiful and scenic place to take a walk. The Weather was awesome. The place has a few tea shops and maggi stalls where one can relax during the walk.

title: Hill view
review: The camel back road is a road that reflects the joy of a couple holding hands and walking and talking together njy get the cool weather and the loneliness of the hill which adds beauty to the natural hill station. If u visit the road ull visit the real happiness of the Mussoorie ...

title: NICE VIEW
review: Its nice to see this view.The hill is looking like a camel.kids enjoyed a lot to see this view.its really nature miracle

title: Easy walk but not green, kind of the backyard of Mussoulie
review: easy walk along the paved road strung around the hills, many ashrams, nice trees and views along the way.

title: time pass
review: it was nice visiting there, had a good fun and nice memories for lifetime, will recommend others also to visit.

title: Full of sights!!!
review: The road was full of fabulous sceneries !!! It is a good place for a walk with friends !!! Stalls fill ur hunger

title: As good it was a little more hotels but still good
