review: Well the walk was always good facing the green valley and mountains I walked early morning with the sun on my face a cold breeze and silence as my partner nice

title: Amazing
review: Horse ride can be taken. One side you can see valley that will mesmerizing you with surroundings. Must visit palce

title: Enjoy a Soothing & Serene walk in Mussoorie..
review: The Camel's Back Road is best done on foot though there is also an option to hike a ride on a cycle rickshaw from the mall road. About 300 meters into the Mall Road (from library chowk side) there is a small alley towards the left from which the Camel's Back Road can be accessed. The exit from the Camel's Back Road is at the other end of the Mall Road (near picture palace). Route length along the Camel's Back Road from library chowk to picture palace and back to library chowk would be around 5 Km.

title: Amazing  place to have  wintry morning walk with proper head and body gears.
review: A early morning walk on this road with head and body properly covered (as the climatic conditions go in minus degrees during December) without  fail  as it  was chilling cold then in Dec.  But  should not  be missed.

title: nice location
review: nice location nice food nice ppl very helpfull n enjoyed alot the overall views from the road.neat n clean always

title: And we rode on the Camel's back........
review: From the Mall the road takes a swerve and we are on the camels back road..........move on a while when we leave the buildings and suddenly the road becomes deserted with  occasional tourists passing by ...we come across pretty estates and the scene of the mountains as we move further ahead is breathtaking ......the air is chilly and we really enjoy it.......at a point under a canopy we halt to have spectacular views of the himalayas....see clouds travelling above .....we reach the Camel's back cemetery which is a thick out groth of vegetation and tall trees...the entrance is a quaint little colonial structure.......we walk on and on and sip a cup of tea at a way side shop which blurts hindi songs ........an enchanting evening of togetherness.

title: Nice walk and amazing view
review: This place is next to Mall road and you can hire a rickshaw to go to camel back point and comeback. However, if you take 2 hours in hand you can walk enjoying some excellent valley view, and also get some exercise. :)

title: group visit, fantastic!
review: Group of more than ten person visited Mussoorie for a day trip from Delhi. It was a summer afternoo, and suddenly there was a heavy pour of rain for more than three hours, so stuck in a restaurant all the while. The camel back road is so romantics and lovely. Must come to this place as eveyone that comes to Mussoorie is jamed up here.

title: One of the highlights, especially because everything else was disappointing
review: A nice walk of about an hour with breathtaking scenery - relatively quiet and a must do. Actually, I think the place is not worthy to be the best thing to do, but the other things like Kemty etc. are disappointing so it comes out even better - Must do if you like walking and some beautiful views..........

title: its is a long stroy about camel back road..its is nice place to go n for some photo shoot also u must visit this place
review: its is a long stroy about camel back road..its is nice place to go n for some photo shoot also u must visit this place

title: Beautiful for Morning Walk
review: Mussoorie get really crowded and noisy every weekend and to enjoy the solitude and beauty of camels back road one much catch it in a early morning and you will be rewarded well with the scenic view.

title: Refreshing
review: The ideal location for a quiet morning walk. Our group had a great time. The views are breathtaking and worth the effort.

title: Nice walk
review: There were hardly any people here while the mall road was bustling with crowds. It's a nice walk down the other side of the mountain. Is definitely much cooler here. It's a very long road so we could only walk halfway with kids and return back. There are no rickshaws available on the stretch. There is a nice viewpoint called Hawa Mahal where we had tea, awesome views of the valley and a guy was playing guitar.

title: Just wow
review: This was the highlight of our trip .. a cycle rickshaw ride to and fro camels back road. We convinced a rickshaw guy to take us to the camel rock point from library. After several rickshaw guys refused this one agreed for just three hundred bucks for to and fro. Which is quite reasonable given the inclines and the distance. The journey to the camel rock is beautiful with excellent valley views .. you will feel relaxed away from the maddening mall road crowd. The whole trip will take clise to an hour ... may be more if you take stops in between.

title: beautiful and quiet walk
review: Really loved doing this walk. Its calm and quiet with very few tourists around. Great view of the himalayas. Recommended to go in the morning when the sun is out. 2-3 small stops for chai etc too

title: Very romantic experience
review: A good long walk with serene surroundings ; go there if you want to walk away from the mall road crowd

title: Thrilling
review: A great place to walk around in monsoons if you are the "Rain Lover" I guess you can add in your 'Couple Goals'

title: Road with awesome view points
review: This is one of the most amazing roads i have visited. The view from various view points on this road is breathtaking and awesome. Well i visited twice, once i took a bi-cycle on rent from the mall road and had a decent ride covering around 5-6 KMS covering the both camel's back road and the mall road. Next day i drove through the road with my friend and enjoyed the beautiful views. Take a walk or hire a bi-cycle. That's the only way you can enjoy this road.

title: Evening walk and cycling experience
review: We found Camal back road in Mussoorie as one of the best attraction with cycling experience. It's like reminiscence of old days and fun with kids, families and friends. The excellent weather condition and traffic free road makes it more enjoyable.

title: Nature trail
review: Nature trail far away from crowd. It is a winding road along the hill with lush green valley on one side for approximately 5 km. One can go for a long walk or hire a bicycle or cycle rikshaw .

title: Mussorie Trip
review: Just next to my hotel nand residency this is a quiet place however the camel view depends on fog conditions.

title: Enjoyed an early morning walk
review: Both ends of this road are commercialised and you have some very average shops. But in between the two ends is a beautiful walk amidst nature with some breathtaking views. Try to go early morning to avoid rush.

title: dont miss this place
review: its nice place for a long walk to relax and the evenng time really awesome, greenary very beautiful.

title: Calm and serene
review: Suitable for those who love scenic beauty and do not want busy and loud environment of mall road. Horse riding available. You can also rent out bicycles. Few sitting areas available to rest and enjoy the valley and weather.

title: Near to my hotel
review: My hotel was located on camels back road so i went there for monring walk and it was amazing feeling and view of valley from cmels back road.

title: Nice Trek n cycling
review: This place has very magnificent view of valleys...The place is calm and quiet...You can hire a cycle and do the cycling...Not worth a miss...a must visit

title: Good,visit once
review: Visit at least once.You can also take a rickshaw.A rikshaw takes about ₹ 300. To and fro. Plus u will see the camel back rock on the way .Take a good zoom camera if u want to have a pic

title: Long, beautiful walk
review: The stretch is a respite from the crowds on Mall road. We loved the idea of walking from the library end to the picture palace end and took a refreshing break at an eatery run by a charitable trust.

title: coolest road
review: one must visit this road as this is the highest and coolest road in mussoorie. During summer you feel the cold breeze like A.C.

title: Smooth & silent Road
review: We hired rickshaws to take us through camel back road from mall road. Charged Rs.250 for this each. This road is away from the hustle and bustle of mall road. Not much footfall on this particular stretch. You can enjoy good scenic view of mountains.

title: Walk on the Camel's Back
review: I want there in the first week of June so it was quite hot and humid at that time. About 56 km from Jolly Grant airport. We took a prepaid taxi to reach there. Amazing views of Doon Valley is the main attraction.

title: Hiking in Mussourie
review: The back gate of our resort (Mahindra club resort) opened at this road and we had a scenic hiking tour for about two hours till the main bus stand. Good way to end a lazy trip and you can also enjoy the food at canteens and small shops along the way.

title: A Trail to Connect you back to Nature
review: Enjoyed every bit of my travel to this route. The road is wide and connects the mall road when it ends. The scenery from this trail will mesmerize you and will leave you spellbound.

title: go after september if you want to enjoy
review: the place has scenic beauty. it is for the people who love the walks . Good clean place  carry the jackets. you will find food sellers on both sides so no issue of any food or water

title: Walking plaza
review: The place is quiet and peaceful. Cool breeze soothe you and the natural growing vegetation provides you fresh air. This road is over 2km long, but you'll to walk and stroll about it during morning and evening. This place is perfect for a walk

title: Lovely long walk
review: morning walk on this road is very soothing with a great view and you might even encounter would be IAS officers galloping on their horses. With no shops on this road, it's a quiet walk where you can enjoy the scenic beauty.

title: Camels Back
review: Very good view of mountains like camel back

title: Not recommended at odd hours
review: This road is at the back of the Mall and is isolated and has lot of monkeys and stray animals too. It is not recommended to stroll during odd hours as its isolated sometimes. Morning/afternoon is the best time to visit

title: Camel rocks!!!!
review: Plz dont forget to walk in this road.Truly a divine experience with perfect sceenrey and majestic natural view.

title: A walkin circumambulation …
review: A small three to four km trek around the hill … it was an excellent evenin walk destination for us

title: Beautiful walk
review: Good sightseeing and relaxing walk, a leisure walk ob this road is advisable, enjoy the beauty of hills

title: Beautiful
review: Most beautiful road in mussoorie to walk in the clouds ... If the weather is good must visit this road with awesom view along with street shopping

title: Excellent
review: We had a great stay at the hotel and the nearby place is camel's back road. wonderful view point. we loved it

title: Good place to roam around
review: gives good look of Mussoorie. peaceful area. a very good place to roam around and spend time with the family

title: nature loving place
review: very nice place for walking and feel nature. best place for walking. great view of mussoori. its a perfect place for photography.

title: Lost in nature...found peace!
review: A trip to mussorie is incomplete without a walk or rikshaw ride on the camel back road!

title: Nice view but the approach to this road is very congested.
review: The hill top which resembles the face and back of a camel as seen through binoculars is on this road which leads to the Mall area. The view on the hill side is nice too but tends to get hazy as the day progresses.

title: nice location
review: We stayed at a hotel in camel back road its a nice road to walk specially during moonsoon or during winter season,its away from the hustle bustle of the Mall road

title: Beautiful surrounding and scenery
review: These is a must visit place in mussorrie.

title: The backdrop of Mussoorie
review: This road offers a breathtaking view of the valley and driving down it in cycles is the perfect way to go about it. Must see.

title: FAR FROM THE MADDNING CROWD
review: When you think of Mussoorie the first thing that strikes your mind is  the hussle bussle of the  Mall Road.  But if you love peace beautiful view of the himalyan range then camel's back road is the place for you.  A 3 km strech behind one end of mall road to the other end is ideal for a walk any time of the day. It has many hotels to stay but no shops except far and few for basic essentials .

title: Shoppers Paradise
review: The name of the road is derived from literally the geographic shape of the Road, which looks like the back of a Camel.

title: NOt so much beautiful
review: Not so much worth to visit during summer.

title: Nice Walk
review: The expectation from the place is was to have a good walk in the lap of nature and it fulfilled that. Must for every couple.

title: Awesome views and nice trek...
review: Its worth tracking down this road which surrounds the awsome views of the valley on the side... all you will hear are the sounds of Birds chirping, chants from the nearby temples ..really peaceful...

title: Road is well maintained.
review: Quite road with nice ambience & weather. Only issue which i faced is cycle Rikshaw was not allowed after the checkpoint, due to which parents were sitting after a 100 mtr walk.

title: Rommatic road to roam around
review: Road is around 3 km length, with beautiful view on one side. Very suitable for couples for a romantic walk breathing fresh air.

title: Very beautiful
review: This road is an excellent walkway with picturesque views, tranquil and relaxing, an amazing option for a stroll.

title: Nice walk / rickshow ride
review: We took a rickshaw around the Camel's Back Road. It is a pleasant ride with good views of the valley below. If you fell fit enough, you can walk the 3-4 kms loop as well. However large parts of the road are full of hotels and lodges and there are just a few quiet stretches left now. Along the road there are a couple of telescope guys who will show you all the famous points of Mussoorie including the Camel's Back shaped rock.

title: Feeling the Air of Mountain
review: The first impression was as if the whole cloud has come on the ground. The breeze was so touchy that it got me goosebumps and the memories of my childhood.

title: A winding road surrounded by forest
review: If you are an early riser on a holiday too, this is a place for you. If you are on a holiday in mountains and want a crisp air, this is a place to be. The sun, when out is soft and intermittent between the dense vegetation.

title: Amazing Road
review: I loved the view from Camel's back road.

title: Ok for one time visit
review: Okayish type. Not much to explore but good enough for a long walk with spouse. Need some attractions to be available here.

title: Very pleasant urban walk
review: This road winds a longer way to connect the two main markets in Mussoorie. The walk is flat, and you can get a good break from the Mall humdrum. With stops ate the three or four lookout points, it should take you an hour or so, walking leasurely and taking in the mountain views.

title: Beatiful view
review: Instructions for reaching the spot for a good view were completely missing, so one has to keep asking people some of whom sometimes are not able to explain correctly and thus lead one to wrong direction. The city administration has ignored the fact that tourists need to be guided to sight seeing spots.

title: Best part of Mussoorie
review: Camel's Back Road -  a very funny name. It is at back of Mussoorie mall and parallel to it.

title: Pathway around a mountain
review: It is pathway around mountain which has shape as of Camel's back. In the path, there are few spots for where you can sit and click snaps, have maggi. It was very aloof so try to go in a group. This is a long walk around 3-4 kms. Otherwise you can choose to go by rickshaw that will charge around Rs 300. I suggest to go by rickshaw because when I visited I couldnt cover the complete path.

title: Do not Miss it
review: We went to this road on our last day and completely blown away by the beauty around to our luck it had snowed 4 days back so there was still some snow around which made it all the more exciting. The walk it one of the best for me, please do not miss it.

title: A midnight walk
review: I walked there with my friends at 12 am,  reached a point where we were able to see the laltibba and nagtippa,  then we realised that there was a beautiful view of himalayas far behind the mountains, the fool moon gave us a mesmerising view of himalayas, the I pointed my camera and with 30 sec exposure captured a picture where himalayas and stars meet together,  if you visit musoorie,  have a walk in  midnight on the street of camels back during fool moon.  You will never forget that experience of watching the mountains under the moon light

title: Amazing views
review: This is a best place to take some beautiful  pics .I enjoyed my walk. Its good for long walk with your partner ,but one thing i must say if you are single its become booring for you .

title: Nice Fool
review: there were so many people who were showing differen camels from different point but we were not able to cee properly and we have visited complete 2.5 km by walk to see camels in mountain finally one telescopic person shown Camels like rock on the top of the gun Hill. That's it

title: A great walk!
review: Best suited for after 4.30pm in summers and anytime in the winter, we were saved by the pram we took for our 4 year old.

title: Good for a leisure walk
review: Enchanting views of the valley. good for a morning or evening walk. Be aware that it can be a long walk, so be prepared.

title: sweet air to breathe
review: sweet air to breathe and pictures to be taken,best on foot 5 km from mall road,do not doubt your stamina,it will 500% more from delhi,after the journey you will not feel any pain in legs or foot.

title: Quiet and serene place in Mussoorie
review: Camels back road is surprisingly close to the crowded parts of Mussoorie. You can go for a long quiet walk on this road in you want to feel relaxed and look at green valley/mountains in front of you. The entire road is concretized so and for most of the stretch there is very little/no change in elevation. Additionally there are several places with benches and shelter to sit and relax. One strange things was despite its reputation and charm number of tourists on this road was close to 0 when we visited. There were a few locals occasionally passing by. Given that I would perhaps be somewhat careful about venturing too far on this road after dark.

title: Peaceful walk along a scenic view.
review: No vehicles on the road makes it quite a lovely walk. About 3-4 view points along the way. Beautiful views.

title: Long Romantic Walk!
review: Was staying in Hotel Mall Palace and had read a lot about this attraction.So we left the room just around sunset and started walking but what we did not anticipate was the distance.Its roughly 3-3.5 km from one end of camels back road to another.Though we were not able to enjoy the view, what we did enjoy was the quiet long walk away from the city chaos.At some places you wont find anything but strange noises from animals and birds, which made the walk more memorable.

title: Heaven close to mall road.This place is worth a walk.
review: Get ready with your shoes on,go for a Walk , Jog or take a By Cycle on rent.This place is beautiful,you will see small shops selling-  Maggie, Biscuits, omelets n tea, sit down for a while a sip a cup of tea with your choice of food. Binoculars n Telescope are available to take a view of the wilderness around, believe me its a treat for your eyes.

title: Do this on foot
review: Great walk with breathtaking views of the valley. Also a great way to stay in shape and work of the breakfast and build up an appetite for lunch!

title: Excellent view
review: You must see how rock formed to get a share of Camel's Back. Take a Binocular to see it and some other surrounding spots. If you are staying on Mall Road - you can take a stroll to reach the place instead of taking a rickshaw.

title: way to heaven
review: we really enjoyed a long walk on this road .calm ,quite,beautiful hills,good people,all around green valley's.oh my good what a cherish place.i m in love with tis and say must visit .its safe and healthy. for body.its almost good 2 km walk from one way up n down 4 km .goog tm for walk is 4 pm to 5 ..30.pm and 6 am to 7 .30am.

title: A walk up the mountains
review: This road is an alternative if you are already tired of your stroll down the Mall Road. An easy and fulfilling option for an evening or morning walk in the laps of nature where you will encounter the locals.

title: Ahh...what a surprise
review: Mussoorie is the go to place for a short weekend trip for a lot of people from Delhi NCR....making it a really really crowded place at times and crowded at others. Camel back road was a plesant surprise...situated parallel to mall road but on the other side of the mountain, it lets you have a look at the himalyas and still have a very peacefull stroll in the morning or evening. A graveyard, numerous vantage points, old ruins and a camel back shaped mountain makes it more interesting.

title: Great view
review: Great view is there in camel back road but take journey by foot instead of rickshaw.if you want to savour all views

title: Tracking
review: Walking on camel's back road n mall road at evening is exciting..we tracked down from ITM guest house to mall road ..good lighting around the shop ...and shops seems to be more costly as compaire to kempty shops ..we checked by asking price of items ..

title: Good to walk on the road
review: We visited it in the afternoon. A very peaceful road to walk on and admire the scenic beauty of camle's back hill. Telescopes are mounted at few places which offers few other points to see like lal tibba etc.

title: An easy walk from camel back road to Library chowk
review: An awesome experience walking from my hotel room facing bang on the camels back view i walked from picture palace down to camels back road stopped and approached a telescope vendor to show me a closer  illusion view of the historic Camels back the naag devi temple and the old mussoorie.

title: Fairy World
review: I would say that if you are in love i.e. if you love your wife and kid then Camel's back road would give you moments to cherish for your lifetime. Although, its a little long road but you should go by walk and NOT by rickshaw.

title: Calm and soothing
review: The road is a typical hill station road which runs parallel to The Mall. During colonial era Camel's Back road was for Indians and The Mall used to be only for Britishers and Rich. History apart, we walked through the road with lot of pride and enthusiasm. It is named after a rock which can be seen on the hillock astride the road, the rock looks like camel's hump. A road which one past through to have fun, calm and soothing effect.

title: Mall Road to Camel's Back Road walk
review: A good 1 and a half walk, with views and shopping.

title: It was a beautiful walk...
review: A peaceful walk through this road on early morning is highly recommended, though I will suggest to have some company while walking this deserted street at that time.

title: Good for walk
review: It is a good walkable spot, with option for Ricksaw ride. Peacefully area. Enjoyable if you are in company/ with family.

title: Far from madding crow8
review: From Gandhi chowk cross police barrier and then turn left from mall road and walk ypto Nadan Reagency and come out at kulri bazar.On way stop in between to see Camel formation made of loose rock.A cemetery on way can be seen, now it's closed for visitors.

title: Good view, I suppose there was good shopping
review: We took a long walk down mall road and then up Camel's back road. It was a fairly long walk but the view was great

title: Good
review: Good walk along the quiet road. Want to spend a peaceful time then it's the perfect place to be. Very near to the mall road.

title: The best place in mussorie
review: Take a long walk here, for an hour or two. See the old world houses, the views. Stop for chai at local cafes. I did this on a Monday and the place was practically ours. Wonderful!

title: Overhyped
review: Its a nothing place. No facility, no maggi point, no sunshine in morning. Just like any other road in a hill station

title: The journey is certainly better than the destination.
review: We took a cycle rickshaw from mall road to camel back point. The entire stretch has a lovely view of the hills and you can enjoy nature and the greenery. But once you reach the spot you are shown the camel back structure (made from natural stone) which is faraway on top of the mountain which was a bit dissappointing.

title: Calm n serene
review: Just take a cup of coffee from any coffe shop at mall but take a walk on camel back road...it is like meditation.

title: English legacy
review: The starting point of the road can be easily missed as it has a small opening and next to the leg and Mall Road but once you get it u see a diff Mussoorie.

title: Great for peaceful walk.
review: Great road for the long walk ,very soothing as its next to great mountains. Surely recommend this for every traveler.

title: Excellent view of Mussoorie
review: Camel's Back Road is amongst the main roads of Mussoorie, gives excellent view of hill station and deep valley. The road is up and down just like the back of camel, so it is named. You will love walking the road in evening, have ice-cream and enjoy the views.

title: short trip
review: very healthy walk, weather pleasant,very scenic area. Great for photographers. The weather was getting colder only at nightfall,mall is at the beginning of the road

title: The best walking route off the Mall Rd.
review: You could take this walk from Picture Palace side or from Library side. The Cemetry (the first one in Mussoorie) with graves of stalwarts such as Fredrick Pahari wilson, his wife Gulabo or the famous writer, John Lang, is a great point to explore or, if you decide not to complete the walk, to turn back.

title: Great view and quite walk
review: Perfect road to roam around if you are a nature lover. Very few or no traffic at times on this road and I loved the walk on this road.

title: Mesmerising views of mountains throughout the distance
review: It's scenic and beautiful. Though we could not see the camel back point due to cloud cover, but the walk through the road was marvelous. There were very few tourists due to off season and rain, however, we were delighted to have a walk through and take snaps freely. Along one side are some hotels, ashrams, a temple and some eateries (not many). There are some covered domes along the route as well. The green cover, the breathtaking mountains, some lonely houses and huts, chai and momos along the way, were pretty enjoyable, more so, with a group of friends. I would rate it as the top tourist attraction and a must visit place in mussorie, though some opinions might differ.

title: Just off the mall peaceful rickshaw ride in the haven
review: Just off the mall peaceful rickshaw ride in the haven

title: walk walk walk
review: i went fr morning walk and it was a great fun to enjoy the nature and having a hot cup of tea on the way ....................must try

title: beautiful
review: Peaceful mesmerising and definitely worth a visit. Do make a trip during Monsoon season and winters especially.

title: awsome experience
review: we made very slow car ride of 3 km stretch of camel back road with stoppages in between specially at hawa mahal and had maggie and tea.it was the best experience at mussoorie and need to have 3 hrs min in the evening.very nice view of mussoorie hills and sunset.the other end lasts at the back of mall road.A must visit place for nature lovers.

title: The Road of Peace and Great Himalya views
review: You can walk from Camel backs road to Suicide point, for breathtaking views , The most peaceful atmosphere where you can enjoy fresh air and excellent views.

title: A breath of fresh air
review: We walked every day on camelback road during our recent 6 day holiday in Mussorrie...

title: a long walk like a honey moon couple..
review: Took a small walk along the way before our shopping in Mall Street.. recalled our Honey Moon walks in Munnar.. simple but the weather makes us romantic while walking... Could not take Horse ride as weather itself is so chilled and need to walk slow to get low cold..breeze

title: Good for a walk early morning.
review: The camel's back road, so called perhaps because of the curves and the hill that looks like a camel's back, offers serene sights of the upper himalaya's snow clad peaks and deep valleys all around. There are points where you can sit and relax on the way as well.

title: Camel's Back Rd
review: A good road for a long walk or a pony ride. Fantastic view of the Himalayan Range. Don't miss the Camel's Back Rock behind (below) Gun Hill and the old cemetery.

title: Long walk
review: Its a long long snakey road,best if you need a good long walk,and you can also see the stoned camel structure apparently created naturally.

title: lovely view
review: one of few places you can probably jog, was empty in dec. told it does get crowded during holidays..

title: Its a road on the back side of mall road
review: This road is shaped like a camel's back.  This road provides lot of views one can walk on this road or can take hire horse from the mall road. Lot of couple come to the camels back road the view from this road is very romantic.

title: Peaceful walk
review: Parallel to the mall Road,  it is as contrasting to the busy mall Road area.  Quiet blissful stretch of 3kms. Even wonderful to walk early in the morning with snow-clad mountains visible in the morning sunlight.

title: Nice place for a peaceful morning walk
review: Nice place for a peaceful morning walk. Must go their for a morning walk. It is peaceful , scenic . Have many view points where you can sit and relax too.

title: Nice for short walks
review: It's like a detour from the Mall road on a road less taken to come back to Mall road again. There's a camel shaped rock mid-way.

title: Stroll, view Sunrise/ Sunset
review: This road runs parallel to the mall road is a relatively very quiet. Ideal for jogging or for a lazy stroll while enjoying views. There are canopies made where one can sit and enjoy sunrise/sunset. You can also find some guys offering you telescope to view some important points in Mussoorie including the mountain that looks so much like a camel from which this road derived its name.

title: Relaxing walk
review: The road gets its name from a rock formation which is visible from the road. The rock formation looks like a resting camel. The road offers a relaxing walk.

title: Nice and interesting
review: Although it is just a road but it offers amazing views that will give you unlimited reasons to admire the nature's beauty.

title: Excellent Walk
review: Great Early Morning Walk (strech of 3km).

title: It's ok
review: It's opposite of mall road. Quite and laidback for stroll in the evening. Don't waste money or time in locating the camel.

title: Drive Road
review: Nice Road for a slow drive on a lazy day or a good walk overseeing the Himalayas. You can Cycle if you like and rent it from the mall road. Enjoy your experiences better with a camera

title: a walk to remember...
review: Camel's back road -  Never expected such a place would exist amidst the hustle-bustle of Mall road. Its an approx 2-3 km road which starts and connects back to Mall road... just go here for a leisurely stroll... traffic is sparse, views are stunning specially during sunset... loved it.

title: Lonely
review: Going alone is a good experience all together,  I could make out camel back hill view on my own. Took lot of pics and had fun.nit much tourist in this part of Mussoorie.  Liked it

title: Great view of Himalayas
review: Its a lovely walk with great view of snow capped mountains. Since vehicles are not allowed its a joy to spend long hours on this lovely road which runs a pretty long stretch.

title: Wonderful walk
review: This is much quieter and more tranquil place than the more popular Mall of Mussourie. From one end of Camel's Back Road to the other end of it takes nearly 45 minutes of pleasant and comfortable walk in the sinuous rills of the hills. In the early morning from some places you can get glimpses of high hills too and some rare and beautiful birds are sure to greet you on your way. As there are no shops lined the way, you can have a leisurely quiet stroll all along with yourself. I personally got some similarities with the Mall of Dalhousie and Darjeeling with this place. It is simply a beautiful walk.

title: Visiting
review: I suggest all of you to go there as from there we can see the statue of camel formed naturally. From there we can also see many places. There are also many guides who helps us to see those places. In this road there is a face of Lord Ganesha formed naturally

title: Camel back road
review: Very nice and beautiful road. ..5km long. ...very  very beautiful place. ..away from hustle bustle of mall road in mussoorie. ..

title: Ver famous Road
review: Camel Back Road is very famous road in mussories. where one can just stroll around in mist of mussorie. to enjoy really beauty and should feel like utarakhandi.

title: Walk around
review: This place is good to take a long walk around (close to 1 hour)  and enjoy the scenic view of beautiful mountains .

title: Drizzling and Misty On The Day Of My Visit
review: Camel's Back road starts near the library and goes around the Gun Hill.

title: Full of MIst With Great Views of Himalayan Ranges !
review: Very famous road in Mussoorie , where one can just stroll around in the mist of hill town to enjoy beauty & should feel like a Uttarkhandi. The lovely promenade starts from Kulri Bazaar near Rink Hall & ends at Liberty Bazaar covering a distance of 3 Kms. Lovely walk with great views of snow capped mountains & to view the sun set. From one end to another it takes about 45 mts by walk.  Much quieter & tranquil place.

title: A pleasant walk
review: A walk along Camel's Back Road is a must when visiting Mussoorie. It is peaceful, scenic and largely free of any traffic. At leisurely pace it takes about an hour or two. However you may wish to spend more time here by stopping at historic cemeteries, walking down steep paths or visiting parks or colonial era houses (need permission from owners). Wild dahlias (flowering in various colours and sizes) are a treat to see. We also came across beautiful birds, monkeys and butterflies, walnut trees (fruiting) etc. Don't forget to look up to spot Camel rock and mountain peaks (well sign posted). If you feel hungry, there are eateries along the way.

title: Not great
review: It can be good if empty and peaceful. Mussorrie has many good scenic points like company garden and lal tibba

title: Good in parts
review: The distinguishing feature about this road is that it is pretty much flat. However it is good in parts. Some stretches are crying out loud for repair while some are just great. One passes a graveyard along the way, which is unique! Further down comes a vantage point from where you can see the ancient temple, rokeby and of course, the natural rock formation that resembles a Camel's back. Hence, the name.

title: Peaceful and free of traffic.
review: one place you must visit if you are going to mussooriee. It is peaceful, scenic and largely free of any traffic.the view are breathtaking and youll find lot of activities.

title: Good place for a lazy stroll
review: Visiting mussorie is to relax and rejuvenate. So an afternoon or an evening stroll on camel back road lets you unwind. Remember there is nothing to do it is just a little more scenic road no adventure. If you are looking for action go to mall road.

title: beautiful walk
review: Just start at one end and reach the other 3-4 km ups and downs... great views, decent crowd... buy any stuff... decent negotiations.... Avoid kids as it becomes too lengthy for them... traffic rules are not followed religiously - few no entry rides made us to mind the traffic... but for that, enjoyed every moment.

title: Must Do in Mussoorie
review: Formation of a rock which gives the perception of a sitting Camel lends this road its name. The road circumferences the northern side of the same hill that hosts the more famous Mall Road on the southern side, with an added dose of oxygen minus the crowd, the high decibel levels, the street hawkers and shops. A definite must do.

title: walk in the nature
review: beautiful, long walk amidst the nature....big mountain on one side and a deep valley on the other with straight deodars , monkey nut and whistling pine tress all around. one finds a few "chai wala dukaans" on the way and a couple of photographers with the gaudy costumes to dress in and pose for and tower viewers to watch the Shivalik ranges

title: Good view of the mountains
review: You can see a view of the mountain in the shape of a camel lying..

title: Good view and very calm.
review: A mountain in the shape of a camel's hump. Stretches from Kulri bazaar to Library.

title: Pleasant walk in Musoori away from the busy streets
review: One of the nicest walks around Musoori. comfortable level road "off the beaten path" away from the hustle and bustle of the shops for a charming and relaxing stroll to enjoy the setting sun.

title: Great place peaceful...
review: Great place to just go out and walk in morning...peaceful...it is on road next to madras cafe on mall road close to  2-3 km walk...view of hills from telescope is available...

title: Very romantic place
review: Its a purely for couple. Very romantic place if there is mist and clouds are mixed. Some lonely walk with your partner.

title: when there is mist and fog its adventurous
review: Away from the noise pollution of the Mall Road, a nice walk, excellent views and photo ops, very clean road

title: For early morning in masoorie camel's back road is best
review: For early morning camel'back road is one of the best place in masoorie nd it is also good at night for saw the outside scenery of massorie

title: stroll on mall
review: clouds formation make this place exotic. The weather was excellent and clouds start anytime. having a stroll on mall road was an experience. have hot coffee near chic choclate shop. very good.

title: Walk on the Camel Back Road in Mussoorie
review: A nice road to take a long walk.. unique and different as the view is fantastic. This road runs parallel to the Mall Road, which is the  main artery road in Mussoorie.

title: Nice
review: Its right next to mall road...best is to get up early and stroll or jog on this road..with great weather its nice to stroll on this road

title: Just a time pass place
review: Its an average place, people say you can go and have walk but frankly speaking I went and clicked pictures and moved ahead.

title: Exhilarating walk
review: The peaceful walk on Camels Back road is surely not to be missed. The view of the Himalayas and the Camels Back itself is so fascinating. With a cup of tea it becomes all the more fun.

title: Just a road hardly can see d camels back
review: One more silly point in masoori... Noting great to see. Natural beauty is spoiled by civilization. Lots of stalls in and around the area which spoil the scenic beauty. You can also use the cycle rickshaw to reach this place. They may charge 100 to 120rs for the ride.

title: Cool place...... for early morning walk
review: Its a decent and natural place... ideal for walk... Surrounded by deodar trees.......

title: ok
review: its the weather that make this road or street little special. But unfortunately it is more of parking road than romantic place.

title: Walk in a nature
review: if you would like to walk in a nature, this is exact place, quite natural and ideal for walk in mountains and you will get excellent view of Himalayas ...

title: Road with awesome views
review: If want to see the real beauty of nature then this road is perfect having some awesome hilly views. No crowd, no noise, no dirt . A long road to enjoy walk . Most peaceful place in mussorie. But for me its too long .

title: Nature at it's best
review: Nature at it best. This is a must do trek. If the weather is good, it is a scenic road, avoid weekends when traffic is high around the place. You can see different mountain views from different locations on this road.

title: very calm and beautiful
review: IT IS very beautiful charming area most of the natures lovers are making morning walk regularly .you can view the himalayas with silver ice from particular place .

title: Not worth it!
review: This is a much hyped up attraction, which is not worth the long walk to it at all. Only go for it if you do not have anything else to do.

title: Best place at mussorie
review: Go for a morning walk and feel the charm of the location. The air is fresh and cool. The view of the mountains, cool breeze, greenery, wild flowers will remain in your memories for ever. Crowd is very less and free from vendors / hawkers. Evening or late afternoon will also be a good time with mist/ fog to enjoy your time.

title: Jannat for nature lovers
review: Anyone who went Mussoorie and didn't visit this site means he is not nature and scenic lover.gems for long walk lovers.

title: eh
review: nothing great just an average road behind the mall, it is just a walf a lil less crowded than the mall

title: Camels Trail
review: Great place to spend quality time. Must see is Captain Young's Bungalow on this road. Supposed to be haunted. He is the founder of mussoorie

title: simple sweet
review: walking zone for all nothing very special mussorie ka me jaha jay jannat hi hai sab kuch mousam pr depend hai

title: Nature walk
review: What a view.....the splendid Himalayas bathed in golden sunshine... The clouds wager to wrap themselves around..... There's lot more to say... But this is the best part where I love to be....

title: Nothing special, if u r not with someone special.
review: A road, ahead mall road, lesser crowd here. What's special. Nothing as such. Just same beauty of nature, clouds, fog, lil cold, golden sunrises n all. It's all nothing special, if u r not looking fir it. But these all become very special, when u r with someone special. U would like to sing n dance hand in hand n to live like that for eternity.

title: scenic place
review: Nearby shopping markets where you can shop and also one can have a view of Mussoorie on one side. It is a bit crowdy place as everyone who comes to visit Mussoorie visits this place

title: Lovely place to visit...
review: If you want to enjoy walking along the clouds with pop-corns in your hand, then you must have to visit here. Its a road,not so long, with road-side markets. Gunhill is at the end of the road.

title: nothing special
review: nothing like watching. all the places r the same. only thing is the weather there in mussorie. so, just enjoy it. worth watching the nearby places.

title: The place is heaven on earth we took a music system  and had a wonderfull time sitiing, listenig gazals its romantic
review: Excellent view, real peace and a heaven for any body who loves to walk moreover there are number of small cottages like sheds made to relax and connect with nature

title: Nice
review: Very nice place for morning & evening walks.Its well maintained road away from city rush........I do miss morning walks on this place.

title: Just Romantic
review: romantic experience with a lot of natural beauty. It is a must go place for couples specially honeymooners

title: Beautiful
review: we walked by this road on a rainy day and the experience is unforgettable. picturesque view line up the entire road.

title: This is what one goes to Mussoorie for
review: Away from the crowds, cars and hawkers is the serene walk on camel's back road. On a good day one can see the lofty Himalayas in full glory but in Juy the clouds obviously blocked any such view. A good walk to enjoy fresh mountain air and good bit of exercise before settling down for some refreshments at either end of the walk. Make sure have good walking shoes and of course some stamina.

title: Lovely place for trekking
review: Wake up in the morning,it will be chilly.But don't stop, get ready and go for trekking. This walk will give you one one the best walk of your life especially "with friends"

title: A calm, quiet walk
review: A visit to Mussoorie is incomplete without a leisurely stroll on Camel's back. A different view awaits you at every bend. The route is serene, quiet and picturesque.

title: A small hill town with a small ring road
review: The Camel's back is the main road in Mussourie which has trees and nature aplenty. It's a ring road in this sleepy hill station that connects the markets and resorts together.

title: Memorable experience
review: Gone with friends, good and very nice place. Walking slowly, foggy area, nice side foods and so much fun  .

title: Nice quiet road
review: Beautiful quiet road with wonderful scenery...quite mystical in rainy season too..highly recommend it

title: Just a view of valley, Be aware if you are couple
review: Best time to go for a walk in this road is after 5PM, u can get stunning sunset on Himalayan peaks.

title: It surely worth a visit
review: If you want to have a leisure walk along with your spouse, this is something not to be missed especially in a light drizzle, view from the road is good. The best part was to view the Camel statue through a binocular, there are lots of street vendors those would offer your binocular service for 20 bucks. Worth a visit definitely.

title: Best area of Mussorie
review: Easily the best area of Mussorie! A long walk across the valley and trees will leave you yearning for more.

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Nice place for a long walk in cloudy day as well as a clear day.

title: Amazing!
review: Lovely walk down one of Mussoories lanes. Amazing Views, Quiet Place, away from the maddening crowd of the Mall Road. Go there to be closer to nature

title: Walking romance
review: If you are not physically fit to climb on hills but love to watch hills and beautiful surroundings this road is for you. On this 3 km long perfectly flat road you will love to walk. Facing the road are beautiful snow clad mountains. On the top of one hill  you will find a rock cut naturally as there is a camel sitting. There are benches where yu can relax. However at peak season the road is crowded with cars and horses that mars the beauty of the place.

title: camel's back road
review: really good trek . beautiful scenery. pleasant climate. good place to hang out with friends and family

title: Peace  walk
review: pleasant walk with gazebo dotted along the entire stretch offering delicious local teas and amazing views of the mountains.

title: Scenic Road of Mussorrie
review: Awesome walk across which really lets you see the beauty of Mussoorie during evening with not much of crowd around, makes it even more pleasant.

title: Relaxing
review: Nice and relaxing walk!!! U can shop around! We loved the view of snow claded mountains from the road! Its beautiful!! Must visit

title: A must for a romantic walk.
review: Nothing but a long walk, joining 2 ends of the mall road. Take a morning walk, peaceful quiet and scenic. Carry water bottles for sure.

title: Waste of time and energy
review: it'd just an ordinary road and nothing much special. View of the peak is there. It has dirty street and too long and tiring.

title: A walk to remember
review: A clam silent place specially for peace lovers, and couples, You will love taking walk in the greens with cold wind striking your face.

title: Divine Walk so close to nature
review: Best place in Mussorie. One of the best places for morning and evening walk. Full of virgin natural beauty

title: Nothing to do
review: This was a place people used to take a ride on horses, but due to all the mess created by the horses and the tourists that's not possible any more.Only thing you can do is probably take a drive.

title: Good place to visit
review: Should try once, good place, should try once in musoorie. The hike is steep and overall a good feel. Might be tiring for some.,

title: Walk in heaven
review: If you are planning to visit Mussoorie then you must have a walk in the evening on this road. Views are beautiful. you will find some man sitting by roadside with telescope. you can have a telescopic look of gharwal himalays also by paying them little money.

title: Good place to visit
review: Must visit place for first timers. Steep slope and you may find yourself over the clouds. Must take some dry food along with you.

title: Must Go
review: People who love to walk..this is must go trail. You will love the views. This is very clean..safe trail. I highly recommend this.

title: good
review: Nice market place you can take a rickshaw or walk on it, Strollers for kids are also available at rent

title: You will enjoy it, if you love walking!
review: Just a tip - You can enjoy being in mountains, only if you enjoy the scenic beauty by walking around, mountains are not to be explored by driving.

title: Just a famous road
review: This is just a famous road in Mussoorie - the queen of hills. I went to Mussoorie on 25th June,2015 and it was raining quite heavily. Couldn't take more pictures hence.

title: Great place to find quality yet affordable accomodation
review: This road, which is just off the Green restaurant , The Mall , Mussorie, has many budget and decent hotels, which offier decent accomodation and good food.  Hotel Deep, Broadway to name a few.  Plus point is it is only 2 - 3 minutes away from The Mall, yet away from the maddening crowd of the mall

title: Scenic walk
review: We walked this road around half the way around and the views were spectacular, people are very friendly, we entered from the mall road side and the path leads to the picture place area...it's a great place to visit just before sunset, full walk is around 4km

title: wonderful walking area on the hills
review: This is an excellent place to take a walk into serenity. Start from Mall road and brings you back

title: good view
review: Good for walk till the old graveyard ...beyond it is cramped hotels and garbage . Return back from Graveyard...

title: Enjoy the Walk
review: Less crowded with excellent view. Return back from graveyard as it becomes crowded after that. Enjoy the weather and views

title: nice for an evening walk
review: Go for an evening walk/run around sunset. It was not at all crowded unlike the mall rd. and you can enjoy the weather and some views at good spots.

title: Good scenic Trek
review: Excellent views of the valley all along. Quite place for an hour long walk amidst nature. MDDA has done a good job in creating resting places at frequent intervals.

title: Beautiful
review: Camel's back road is beautiful place with birds chirping around all the time.  You can see very colourful flowers and different species of birds and butterflies.

title: I walk a lonely road rhe only one I have never could have thought of...
review: The day we visited here had already gone through vast rains and it was 4:00pm when we started walking on the road. Me and my wife were in awe to have scene such a beautiful road passing alongside deep hill facing other many hills as far your eyes could see. We were tired and still managed to cover whole stretch entering from one side of the mall road to another side passing through many twist and turns with a new view of the hills at every damn turn. It was amazing...and for a photographer it is a paradise on earth.

title: Serene, calm n beautiful !
review: Tranquility at its peak ! Road less visited but gives some awesome views.  The road starts from one end to the Mall road and connects back at the other end.  Enjoy the walk without much hurry, take breaks when you get tired, click pictures and enjoy the weather.  Nature lovers - must visit.

title: Perfect for Quiet Contemplative Walks
review: Great ambiance of travelling to an older time! Completely quiet, lined with beautiful (and gently scented) trees, a lot of old houses, some in good condition, some less so, but all very interesting to look at, nonetheless. There are a few areas for sitting, with tea shops and great views. Perfect for sunrise/sunset.  After the hustle bustle of mall road, it's a breath of fresh air.

title: Just a winding road.
review: Just a winding road. Not much to explore. can keep walking on this at great distances. Hire a bike for greater experience.

title: Too Long
review: Didn't find anything to see or enjoy throughout the way but if you are a fitness freak then it is a good idea to take a round in the mourning.

title: Ride on a rickshaw on Camel's Back Road
review: We had a thrilling ride on a cycle rickshaw on Camel's back road from mall road.Really loved the greenery and the views.

title: over hyped place
review: dirty and stinky entrance to the road, due to hotel's washroom near the entry of the road, it was very stinky.

title: looks great
review: I went for a little walk and discovered the true beauty of mussoorie.. yeah its camel back.. the scenic views of garhwal hills are just breath taking

title: scenic
review: stunning views from camel back.. as if we are into garhwals... though not as smooth. the matter should be looked into by the concern authorities.. go for a walk and u will feel like it should be never ending

title: Nice walk way
review: Its a quite path situated at the back of Mussorie. Its good to take a walk instead of hiring Rickshaw or Horse. Preferable time- Evening or Morning to enjoy the landscape.

title: Great for a morning walk!
review: Our hotel was very near to the camel back road. Therefore on all days of our stay in mussoorie, we went on morning walks on this road and it was amazing. It gives very good view of the hills and valleys of mussoorie.

title: long walk
review: one will have high expectations to see something exciting for you you have walk for 4 kms.  then you will be shown camel structures through telescopes.  disappointing

title: Modernisation killed it
review: 1. Its a gud leisure walk interconnected wid mall road.

title: A quieter, cooler walk thanThe Mall
review: Camel's Back Rd starts from near Green's Restaurant in Kulri (at the bottom of Kulri Hill) and winds around the North side of Gun Hill / Camel's Back (there really is a rock shaped like a camel's back - look out for where the men with the telescopes are based). The road hits The Mall at the round hawa ghar where you can get horses to ride. The Mall and Camel's Back Road make a wonderful walk with great views to the Doon valley and then to the snows (on a clear day). The road passes various nice old houses, lots of ugly concrete hotels and the old cemetery (jncluding a resting place for Parsis next door).

title: Peaceful walk!
review: A peaceful walk away from the rush of the Mall Road... Highly recommended as an ideal walk in the hills.

title: amazing views
review: A very quiet road to take stroll over this road. A long road offers stunning views of mountains. You can find lot many birds on the way

title: not worth it
review: Don't go there...just a rock you can see but you won't get any conveyance....could be very tiring....

title: Best road for walk
review: Camel back is the best place for evening walk indeed. It is peaceful, clean and safe. View is breathtaking and uninterrupted. I can be there every single day of my life.not much restau rant, just a canteen by a ashram.

title: Must visit
review: This is lovely place for solitary walks, hiking and photography. If you love nature, you must visit this area and just gaze at the mountains.

title: Amazing stretch of a narrow road. very picturesque and quite.
review: Should visit this stretch of road for a peaceful experience with nature. the view is awesome.Amazing stretch of a narrow road. very picturesque and quite.

title: For those who love to be with themselves
review: In sharp contrast to the hustle and bustle of the mall road this is a paralell road with amazing peace and serenity. Ideal place for long walks in natural surroundings.

title: WORTH A WALK
review: If you want to see sunset in Mussoorie this is the place to be.  Once clear of the houses this road gives some excellent views of the valleys around Mussoorie and of Gun Hill.  Make an evening walk out of it and then head back to Mall road for dinner.

title: Good place
review: It's a good place to pass your time. The shops are a bit expensive. Do negotiate while buying anything or shop at place where they have fixed price. In many places there are chairs to relax and there are places where you can click beautiful pictures with scenic view. I loved this place.

title: Pleasant silence - Soothing
review: The Mall road is quite outdated now. It is way too crowded. This road provides a soothing sensation and it must surely be visited so that you can experience a pleasant tour to queen of hills !

title: Nothing to see
review: This was really sad. There is nothing to see, waste of time and really crappy. Please do not waste your time and energy on this.

title: A small stretch good for shopping lovers
review: I visited in may 2015 with family, this is a narrow road and crowded with shops and shoppers. Since most of the budget hotels are located in The Mall Road and this is one branch of The Mall Road and crowded. This road is in good location and specially you will get lot of local vendors who sell Momos, a traditional food of this location.

title: A Good Place for a Stroll if you want to escape the hustle bustle of town
review: This is a pleasant walk from Mall Road to the Library Square - the other side of hill station. Not much traffic - few good rest spots to enjoy the view. While Mussorie town itself didn't appeal to me much - if you are here might as well make the best our of it and do this walk either early morning or in the evening.

title: Natural beauty
review: Hello, a nice cosy walk on the evening on camel's back road with an excellent view of nature, you can also one natural beauty that is a Rock formation camel on top the hill.

title: Very Nice Sunset
review: Good place to enjoy Sunset. You can sit on benches and enjoy sunset in evening. Walking distance from Mall road.

title: For Mild Walk
review: Best place to walk around the heart of mussoorie. Its long 6 km walk is far better than the 2 km walk over mall road from library to picture palace. The scenic beauty can be enjoyed best in the group of nature loving people.

title: peaceful road to walk
review: the view is nice to have a pleasant walk........we were 4 friends walking in the early morning.a must see place

title: Serene
review: It is a pleasure to walk on this road as one gets away from the crowds on the Mall road.

title: One of the best places
review: Its a nice place to go for a stroll or paddle rickshaw ride. At the end on the road (from where you can see the camel shape rock) you will find Pradeep with his binoculars. He is a good guy. Charges Rs. 30 per site and if you take all, its for Rs.100.

title: A beautiful walk
review: The road is called Camel's back road as one can see the stoned hillock in that shape on the way. Its a beautiful road to walk and feel the quiet inside and outside. Perfect walk in rains / evening / before sunrise and during sunsets. One can see the beautiful viewpoints on the way. Rickshaws can drop you till there.

title: Beautiful walk, far from the madding crowd
review: A must-try item for anyone new to Mussoorie. Beautiful walk behind the mountain. The view of the Camel's back itself is not very appealing (to me), but the views of the valley are nothing short of breathtaking. Take your own sweet time to walk the entire stretch. Stop somewhere for a cup of tea and snacks and end the walk with a lovely sunset!

title: Nature's Beauty
review: You can take lot of pics on the camel back road .Basically its a beauty of nature . I love this place . This is situated on the hills of Mussoorie .  Its a beautiful walk behind the mountain.

title: Very Nice and beautiful walk.
review: Musr take a walk on this road. it is an experience. better if you go early Morning

title: SO NEAR, YET SO FAR
review: Mussorie was once hailed as the Queen of Hill Stations..

title: Lovely drive.
review: You can take a pony ride here, and walk to various view points. Lots of traffic up here, as its a favourite spot to get a view of the snowy Himalayas in the distance.

title: A relief to find a quiet pleasant road without the huddle and bustle
review: After traipsing through the busy huddle bustle of the Main Street, Camel back road was just what we needed! There were very few cars and no other people at all! The views of the Himalayas were spectacular and we found a kiosk which sold a post card explaining the names and height of all the mountain peaks. A really beautiful area.

title: Good place
review: Good place to visit and walk around nice crowd, wonderful views. Shops and food points are bit expensive but you can get some good experience.

title: a beautiful peaceful walk under the nature
review: starting from library point to kulri bazaar,camel's back road is a must visit in mussoorie. one can vitness a romantic sunrise and sunset from this road. really refreshing to walk on this road with nature all around. becomes a bit crowded in summers but nonetheless worth visiting. you can even enjoy snacks and amazing view of doon valley from this road...

title: Awesome view
review: Its the highest point in Mussoorie and the walk around the mountains is awesome. Suggest make the trip in the first half as it gets chilly in afternoon

title: Himalayan Valley View
review: It is a road that leads to a point where you can see a rock shaped like a camels back.The road is about 1.5 Km long and with a beautiful valley view showing the himalayan hills.Nature lovers can enjoy the scenery. Auto/taxis are not allowed thro' this road. Only cycle Rickshaws are allowed.Cycle Rickshaws are available from Mall Road.The rent for the C Rickshas are displayed on the board.Youngsters with capable strength can walk/trek thro' the road.It will be a nice experience if you go in the early mornings.

title: View Points all along the road are amazing
review: Must visit place in Mussoorie.

title: Great views
review: Nice walk along a quiet road with awesome views of the foothills of the Himalayas and a sneak peak at the big snow capped mountains.

title: Memorable mornings spent here
review: I am a morning person, I came here for walk with my partner every morning during our stay. We covered the complete circle from hotel (at Mall) via Camel's Back road. The road itself is approx. 1.5 Km long. There are beautiful sheds at 2-3 points of the stretch where you can sit back and enjoy the view. Good and safe for joggers and females.

title: A lovely view
review: A great place to visit while going to Mussorrie. A nice drive while you reach there and a good view.

title: Good History
review: Indians were told to use only this road and not5 the mall road back then so from history point of vioew good

title: A Lovely Scenery
review: This is 3 Km long road starting from Library Point to Kurli Bazzar. Due to presence of natural lay out of rocks shaped like a camel hump at the end of road, the road is called Camel"s back road. Local people as well as tourist like jogging/walking in evening/morning.A amazing  view of nature at doon valley. you can see sunrise/sunset from this road.

title: Serene and sublime
review: Great for a quiet and peaceful walk in the woods. View of the valley is stunning. Rickshaws don't work there. And if they do, its Rs. 260 to and fro.

title: Very poor roads.
review: Unclean roads with very poor condition. vehicles parked on the sides makes the condition of the road much worse

title: glorious walk!
review: Loved our walk on the long winding road!  There were hardly any people.  The fresh air was energizing.  It was such a delight to pass by beautiful wild flowers that grew on the side and take breathtaking views of the hills.  A must do for nature lovers!

title: a peacefull walk
review: i accidentally came through this path and i must say it was one of the best walks of my life. Serene, beautiful and so calm. A must if you visit mussorie

title: A view of rock formation like camel's back from the road to Chamba and Surkanda devi.
review: This can be seen from the road to Chamba and Surkanda Devi . A rock formation from distance on the mountain looks like camel's back.

title: Not as great as thought
review: it was a good place for couples to take a walk. Nothing so great as the name suggested - Camel's Back Road...there was a small camel on top of a small hill that is all

title: I come here for serenity
review: I often visit Mussoorie and Landour, and always stay in Emerald Heights Hotel, which is on the Camel's Back Road. This is a scenic, serene, and  empty road, excellent to have a lonesome or a romantic walk. Have a cup of tea, and maggie at hawa mahal, a very small outlet run by old couple. I enjoyed having hot steaming noodles in the cold evening of December.

title: A Peaceful Stretch Away from the Mall Road
review: The Mall road is full of traffic & People. If you want to get the hills experience, just head off to the camel back road, right off the main mall road.

title: Really view like Camel's Back
review: It can one of the best hill viewsif u are a peace/ nature lover. You will definitely enjoy an evening or morning walk with ur partner. But dont forget to take an umbrella with u coz u cant say about Mussoorie's weather & rain.

title: Nothing much to expect on this road
review: Nothing much to expect on this road, had drove through car on this road. Long 3 Km road with normal mountain views which are common across any hill station.

title: A plesant stroll!
review: Okay first things first, Camels Back road gets its name after the rock that is in the shape of a camel. It is unique and is another wonder of natures art. Its best to walk all through the road and the evenings are pleasant! The road has spots to sit and just enjoy the view!

title: peacefull walk
review: the lush green trees and cool place to go for a walk. Its clean place .You will enjoy the walk. Specially the old cemetery and the camels back view on top of the hill.

title: Great for an afternoon-walk
review: I loved the view as we walked along the 3k stretch of road that took us past haunted-looking bungalows and many plants. The entire path is secured with grills on the open-side as any fall can be fatal. Try to buy some water/milkshake/juice and snacks when you see a store as there are only a couple on the entire stretch.

title: Nice, quiet road with serene views of himalayan peaks
review: While walking on this nice, quiet, road you can enjoy serene views of himalayan peaks. The traffic is almost nil here and there are a few viewpoints where you can sit and enjoy the view, in a shade if you want. There is a also a small tea shop run by an old-aged couple on the first view point.

title: If you are looking for a peaceful walk
review: The road runs parallel to the mall, but is quiet. The view from the road is average as Mussoorie has places with much more scenic views like Landour. It's a good place for a walk in the day, with a couple of small joints selling snacks, so carry your own water. The walk is almost entirely level, with no hilly inclines.

title: Good View Of Lal Tibba & Other Area of Mussoorie
review: U get to see Lal Tibba from here through Telescope & also if u dont take help from the person Operating the same,I bet if you find the Camel`s back on your route.Also some othe interesting places can be seen through the same Telescope.it may get tiring if you have children with you,so better carry some finger food as well as water alongwith

title: Pleasant evening walk
review: Camel's Back Road bifurcates from Mall Road near Library Bus stand. One can walk or hire a cycle-rikshaw. The curved zigzag path is a pleasant walk with valley view on one side. The other side is residences, shops etc. As you walk about a km. you come to the end with an excellent view point. The hill separating the district of Dehradun and New Tehri has a clear shape of camel"s back. Telescopic views of Himalayas is excellent. Binoculars will add to the advantage.

title: long walk
review: Although it takes time, one should try walking the entire length of Camel's Back Road just to get a feel and view over the Himalayas from here. Atmosphere changes from corner to corner, no worries about food, there is a place for that with an awesome view. If not a walker, take the horse.

title: Delightful little road
review: Delightful little road in Mussoorie, this brings to mind all sorts of images of the 'Raj'. One wonders what life would have been here in those days. Today the place swarms with tourists, and naturally it has taken its toll. Nevertheless, it still retains its charm, and is an integral part of a visit to Mussoorie.

title: A long romantic walk
review: It was a Sunday and we hardly saw ten people along this long road that offers a beautiful view all along. There isn't much to do so preferable for nature-lovers only. It offers amazing solitude, you feel relaxed and rejuvenated.

title: Nice and Quiet Walk
review: A very beautiful walk with some very beautiful views. It was a very pleasant experience. They have seats at many spots in between where you can sit and relax.

title: In peak seasons this is the only quite place
review: Good for morning walks..... can have breakfast at the Nirankari canteen.... come here if you want some peace...

title: Walkers paradise
review: This scenic road of Mussoorie is perfect for walking. It is more or less flat road although in the hillside. One can enjoy walking around with stunning views all around, very quiet, greenry everywhere. It's real pleasure to be here. While going around one can see very interesting places and it's very popular among morning walkers. If you love walking don't miss it.

title: Scenic Beauty !!!!
review: If you love to walk and enjoy the natures beauty then this is the place to go for. 3-4 km walking stretch is full of Natures beauty and an eye to treat. Very peaceful and fresh air in the morning. Beautiful.

title: Nice place for walking and views
review: This is a morning walkers' paradise. Its a clean more or less plain road with just a few tea shops.You can walk in peace while enjoying the scenic views.

title: For Walkers!!
review: If you like morning or evening walks and you enjoy the company of peace then this is the place for you. The road is 2-3 km long with no city noise , no hawkers, no shops like mall road but a beautiful view.

title: not worth
review: nothing much what you see is camel's back like rock from a distance. it is walking distance from Mall road

title: Wonderful place to just spend an hour walking
review: Let's be clear: Camel's Back Road is not going to give you thrills, great food or music.

title: just pass through it for the fun of seeing
review: the road is a taxing ride as you have to climb climb and than come down. but its fun seeing this as it resembles to camel back. You need to go to its specially as its part of Mall Road shopping area.

title: Nice Walk
review: We started our walk on this serpentine  circuitous road from Picture Palace end of Mall Road in Mussoorie, and finished our walk at Gandhi Chowk or Library end of Mall Road. This 3 Kilometer walk on the surrounding hill path in the morning made us fresh. Road without traffic and city noise gave us cool walk. On one side is the hill and on the other is deep valley. Far away one can  see the tops  of Himalayan Range. Cool breeze freshens you.

title: You can see the Himalayas from here !
review: When you get to the top be sure to visit the little café at the back. It looks a bit thread bare but the staff are lovely - friendly and helpful. They will bring umbrellas in you need shade, the tea and snacks are tasty and the view is pretty spectacular.

title: Quiet Place
review: Different Mussoorie off to mall road. very quiet and clean. View from the road to Camel's back is very good.

title: Walk through garden of Eden
review: Nice winding quiet road on the other side of noisy and polluted Mall Road.One can have beautiful views of hills of mussoorie from this road.This road is very good for people who love morning

title: Nothing much here, can be skipped
review: Its just a road, which will be a long tiring walk for most.

title: You can go and see it
review: This is a place from where you can see a rock in the shape of camel with the help of telescope. Around 4 Kms from the city. Very calm and peaceful place with hill view. Rickshaw wala will charge you around two hundred Rs for pick and drop.

title: Views of the Valley
review: You can certainly get an awesome view of the valley from Camels Back Road. Enjoy the sitting areas on the way for this sort of tiring walk in case if you dont want to drive.

title: Peaceful walk
review: Its a nice walking trail just adjacent to hustle-bustle of city, starting at one end of Mall road and edxtending upto the other end of it. Its middle part is so serene and peaceful with beautiful views of the valley and camel's back rock (A natural rock formation shaped like a camel's hump). If you want to take a break from the maddening crowds of Mall Road and ready to walk for 3-4 Km go for it.

title: Go for a Morning walk
review: Go for the morning walk...nice views from here..beware of monkeys though.

title: Walk with Nature
review: It is a road anybody will be happy to go through.  This road takes its name from a rocky outcrop in the shape of a camel's hump. Along the road, a 180 years old British cemetery is located about mid-way on the loop. The walk is  aprrx 3-4 km, The Camel’s Back road starts from Library point and goes  towards the Kulri Bazar. It is an ideal spot to hang out in the morning and the evening. Witnessed a beautiful sunrise and sunset from this road, a perfect way to walk along with mother nature. It faces the northern range of the Himalayas. We enjoyed light snacks and amazing view of valley while walking. But it was a little crowded during summer. I visited Mussoorie 8/9 times and whenever I am there, I try visit this place alone, it gives me a chance to mix myself up along with mother nature. It is a must visit place while staying in Mussoorie.

title: Welcome Respite from Frenetic Mall Road
review: This 3km stretch of road affords great views and a relatively peaceful break from the traffic and noise of the Mall Road. The road surface is fairly level so ideal for an early morning walk. There is an old British era cemetery and entry chapel with an historical marker part way and otherwise just a chance to soak up the hill station atmosphere in a bubble of calm. Be sure to note the famous roller rink near the terminus furthest from Library Bazar.

title: not worth a walk
review: its just a peaceful diversion from the mall road,better enjoyed with your loved one. it is full of houses private lodge and 2-3 hotels. the mall road has better views than this.

title: crowded by hotels and stinky
review: When we used to go for a walk on camels road a few years back.....it ws awesome but now u see cars parked ...heaps of disposals.very stinky road

title: very scenic
review: very scenic view through out, you see people going for walks and admiring the mother nature.. its a awesome place.

title: Wonderful Road..
review: Must walk on the road in morning/evening. we were the first time visitors and someone was trying to make us fool. he was trying to show us camel hump through binocular. but the camel hump is basically a camel shaped rock that is a small rock and it is situated above the tea shop where you find binoculars on the Camel back road. It is 100mtrs from Nand residency if you come from Mall road, SBI branch/ GPO.

title: Amazing walk!!
review: Was in Mussoorie the first week of July '14. The monsoons were yet to catch up so the weather was cloudy and not hot at all.

title: Average place
review: Its a long road at the end one natural camel was formed by stone.one can take a rickshaw to this place.If you dont have much time you can skip this.

title: Its just a Road
review: I was expecting much more scenic beauty and something different. Only thing I liked about it is that it is a calm road for an eve or morning walk....better than the mall road..

title: A nice walk on Camel's Back Road
review: Peaceful walk with beautiful surroundings is what you get at this road. One must not miss to walk on its around 2 Km stretch.

title: peaceful walk
review: we were there  few weeks ago, it is an amazing walk. I rented a horse for some fun. It is a great place for a walk in the evening. The road takes you upto other end of Mall road. but we returned from mid way as it was getting dark

title: Had a good trip in the car
review: It is nice to travel through the Camel Back Road area, reminds of the OLD School days at Mussoorie, would love to repeat such a trip and advise others to visit.

title: My loving place
review: A lovely atmosphere with a good mountain view. I prefer this place for a cool morning walk. All the way a total greenery with a cool breeze of fresh air.

title: No Horse Riding
review: We went to Mussoorie after a number of  years. Thought might get to do Horse Riding. But its just an ordinary street now. The view of the peaks is there nothing else.

title: Good Road for Walking
review: Nice road and beautifull views of the mountains. One can see many people early in the morning hours having a stroll and in the evening, one can see the sunset from this point. From one particular place, you can see the snow covered mountains too.

title: Charming
review: We hired a cycle rickshaw to cover this 3/4 km stretch of road.The scenic views were awesome.We also stopped to get a telescope view of the locality.It was time and money well spent.

title: Camel rock
review: You will have to walk a lot but the camel rock is something natural and very hard to distinguish.There is nothing very fascinitating about Camel Rock.

title: best enjoyed with your loved one!
review: camel back road is one of distinguished place on mussoorie. it over looks the valley located behind the town.

title: for a long and calm walk
review: 1 you can cover it by a rickshaw also ..It starts from Library and takes you at camel back road to almost back of Green hotel at Mall.

title: This is natural and not very distinguishable
review: If you like to walk then it is good place to walk down to Camels rock on the camel road.This is not very distinguishable but the natural beauty is good.

title: It's all about the journey!
review: The road is beautiful for a walk or can be traveled by a rickshaw. There's nothing very special about the landmark which is basically a natural phenomenon but the way leading up to it can be enjoyed.

title: Peaceful walk away from the mall road
review: If you are going in the peak season you will find the mall road crowded, polluted and with lot of noise. you will not feel that that you on the hill station.
