Take a walk at the camel back road which is of around 2 kms from picture palace end to library chowk end. It is well lighted and a walk in the night can be taken. There are sparsely located buildings with lot of greenery. Very nice to walk in rains in the morning.

title: Away from the chaos
review: The walk along the grave yard and the gazebos looking into the valley. It really is a welcome change from the plasticky artificialness of the mall road.

title: must visit
review: camel's back road is a must visit place...prefer walk..so that one can enjoy that place fullest..this road provides you a great views of valleys and also some coffee shops are there to retain your energy..take a hot coffee in chilly eve and prefer a long walk.

title: WOW!!!
review: Do take a walk on this road. Complete peace and scenery to enjoy on the way. We Choose to walk instead of horse ride, but the experience was amazing. Not to be missed if you are nature lover.

title: Best for a Long walk.
review: We enjoyed a long walk from picture palace and to the the library end. You will enjoy the views, it will take around 30-40 Minuets one should try thist in the evening before sunset.

title: Lovely walk and great views
review: This road is excellent for a stroll in peace and quiet and to get away from the chaos and hustle on the mall road.  The road is lined with old and some new houses and a few gazebos with benches from where you can take in the views of the Garhwal Himalayas.  A few refreshment shops also line this road.

title: Nice Walk
review: The camel's back road is a nice level walk, on a clean road starting at the Library chowk and ending near/ahead of the ropeway on mall road.

title: Pleasant walk
review: A pleasant walk with picturesque scenery. On a clear early morning or late afternoon you can snake your way from one end to the other (both connecting on different ends of Mall road). It is tranquil, removed from the chaos of Mall road.

title: Great and Easy "Nature" Walk
review: Camel's Back Road, while not a super exciting or challenging, is still a must if you go to Mussoorie/Landour. The scenery is gorgeous. A half an hour on the Came's Back will revive even the most nature-starved Delhi-ite. In addition to the breathtaking trees and flowers, you can see various kinds of birds and some really beautiful houses. And, if you go on a clear day, you'll have a rare glimpse of the Himalayas on one side during the daylight hours and in the evening the twinkly Dun Valley on the other.

title: clean roads, restricted traffic
review: you cannot take yours car into road, without charges, nor bike,

title: Nice lonely and long walk
review: This road which starts near Library chowk is best suited for adults with their loved ones either early morning or sunset time. Its around  3 Km walk and you can have hand pulled rickshaws too which would cost around Rs 200 for a round trip. Usually road is deserted which is an added attraction for a crowded hill station.

title: One of the most peaceful walks you'll ever take!
review: This is a walk that you should take alone. That is the only way you will be able to take in serenity, the peace of that it offers. You will hardly see any vehicles, nor will you see any other people.

title: Bachpan ki yaadein.
review: We had a house on camel's back road its truly as amazing as it can be.

title: Nature Walks
review: Must enjoy Nature Walk at Camel Back Road in the morning and evening while your stay at Mussoorie.The walk is almost 8 km where you shall hear only the sound of humming birds,pine tree leaves and very quite path full of Oxygen.

title: Panoramic view from camel Back Road.
review: Walk and enjoy the scenic beauty of valley and snow clad mountains.It is in the midst of city but far away from maddening crowd.Calm,peaceful and tranquil.A must stroll.

title: Camel's Back Road forms a loop with Mall Road!
review: Wonderful walk along the backside of Mussoorie with views of the snow covered Himalayas.  The good news is that it forms a loop with Mall Road.  One end start near the Library Chowk.  It reconnects to Mall Road at Kalsang restaurant.  As you walk pass the Camel Back and the cemetery, look for an uphill path on the right.  There is a sign post the points the way to Mall Road.  It is best to go in the morning to see the Himalayas.  They tend to cloud over in the afternoon.  The walk is very flat and easy.  Our kids did not complain once!

title: Quite and Charm in Itself
review: Camel's Back Road has its own charm, mostly secluded and nice walking time with good view of mountains. Once can enjoy on rickshaw as well.

title: Must go once...early in the morning...feel connected to nature
review: I feel its nice romantic path way with your partner. Me and my partner took a nice long walk early in the morning. It was little away from our hotel, but it was worth. Early in the morning the beauty of nature was absolutely stunning. One feels quite close to nature as you can see beautiful mountains around you and you are walking down the street without being disturbed by any sort of vehicles/traffic. I would definitely recommend to walk rather than taking a Rickshaw, if health permits. It should be in the morning to feel that fresh air and nature beauty. Although its difficult to find that camel stone when one is walking, as it is in the middle of nowhere. One definitely needs direction to find it. We could not find it unless we were shown direction by one localite. In case the motto is to go and see that Camel stone, it may not be a good idea to walk that long. However, If it is about being closed to mother nature and enjoy the feeling of liberty, this walk is must. Go with your partner...Hand in hand..it will be thoroughly romantic experience.

title: Nice long early morning walk
review: The air was fresh and fragrant and there were just a very few occasional walkers. No crowds, no horses and ofcourse no Camels. I watched the camel's silhouette from the beginning of the walk, very interesting indeed

title: Great for early morning walks
review: Early morning or late evening are the best times to walk on Camel's Back Road. So calm and peaceful! Features an awesome mountain view..Sometimes you may run into a Langur [Baboon]! They are totally non-threatening and will watch you as you walk by.

title: A walk along the hillside!
review: this walk is quiet, shaded off and on and offers some spectacular views of the surrounding hills...it joins up with the Mall after a while  or at Picture Palace later! an enjoyable outing for an hour and a half or so..

title: A walk along a serene edge
review: Camels Back road, is probably the only tourist attraction in Mussourie that I spent considerable time at, other then the Mall road of course. The walk is about 3-4 kms through a path lining the edge of the mountain. You can see beautiful views of the valleys and the majestic peaks of Gangotri in the distance. The atmosphere is tranquil and serene except for the occasional motorist. One can take a cycle rickshaw also to enjoy the place but a walk is highly recommended. There are various benches and vantage points to observe and take in the scenery.

title: Peace, finally
review: Visitors to Mussourie would be familiar with the rush on the Mall road- and there's hardly any tourist alternative close by. However, if I had wanted to see crowds amid lots of noise- I'd have stayed at home, thank you. So this place came by as a pleasant surprise- We looked it up on the map and simply kept walking. You'd love it if you are a nature lover- as the view is quite beautiful, though your experience would depend on the weather a lot. Thankfully, we had a pleasant, cloudy weather that morning and the walk was a treat that reminded us what vacations are supposed to be.

title: Great Holiday
review: Nice walk from Mall road to Camel Back Road point but it really unique and a good walk to and fro from this point. You can have horse back ride too to this point from Mall road.

title: Quite a view from the road
review: Road stretches from Mall Road, gives an awesome view of ice covered himalayas on the side. Perfect for a morning/evening walk due to low traffic.

title: A walk to remember
review: Our family, me, my husband & our 3 yrs old boy started walking through this road and all of us immediately became mesmerized by the scenic beauty and spectacular view of the nature. There is one view point from where one can take telescopic view of Himalaya. Overall experience of this attraction is very good. But one should be prepared to take a long walk, preferably in the morning.

title: Good View From Here
review: This is a good place at Mall Road... It gives a Camel's Back like view of the three adjoining but far away mountains...

title: Good natural hill views
review: The Camels Road is a very busy street in Mussoorie with lot of shots, tourists retreats & hill views looking like a camel's back.

title: Silent walk
review: A walk on the Camel's back road is like a trip down the memory lane. Since i grew up in Dehradun, we used to come to Camel's back very often in our summer holidays. The view is fantastic from the entire stretch of the road. The old graveyard still hold its errie charm & the formidable gate where we placed a lot of bets on who will go in at midnight, still holds tall & sturdy!

title: peace ful and quiet location for long walks
review: Calm and quiet location for long walks . Aloo parathas at nirankari canteen located on camels back road available in morning are awesome

title: 4km walk, worth it
review: Nice gazebos to rest after walking, nice views of the Himalayas and nearby villages. Can also get a ride on a carriage or horse if you are willing to spend (200rps-800rps)

title: Nothing to look for
review: We heard about a lot about this road and visited this road. There was no one visible and road was totally alone.

title: Good one hour walk, close to the Nature and very less Traffic
review: I love it. Camel's back road in mussoorie is one place I love to visit in Mussoorie. Good weather, less traffic (compare to mall road or other main roads), lot of greenery, quiet and peaceful area to walk. It takes 1 and half hour to compete the stretch. Don't forget to stop over at tea cum snacks stall of elderly couples. Perfect place for a break, tea and some good photo shoots.

title: beautiful walk
review: a very quiet 2.5 kms walk. ideally to be done early in the morning. beautiful view of the mountains and the himalayan ranges. managed to click a lot of pictures.

title: Excellent road
review: This is an 3 kms long road starting from Library and ending at Kulri Bazaar. Peaceful for a leisurely walk or horse ride. Excellent view of the Himalayan range. The hill looks like a sitting camel .Hence the name. One can get a great sunset view.

title: Mussoorie Meander
review: A great quiet little walk around the back of Camel's Back Hill and Gun Hill with great little viewpoints of the Himalaya's, nice way to get from one side of town to the other

title: Nice Horse Riding Road!
review: Must try if you are in Mussoorie. This road is easily accessible from Mall road. Could be explored on a horse or by walk.

title: Amazing place for a Walk!
review: it is a fabulous place for a long long walk. you' ll witness scenic panoramas while having a walk. u can also take a horse. Also there are a few foodies through the path.

title: Cloudy & very pleasent
review: Nice walk in the clouds with showers. Keep your umbrella ready for unexpected heavy showers. Enjoy the weather with hot PAKORAS with the locals REAHRI WALA.

title: a must walk
review: nice one hour refreshing  walk. starts at Kuldi mall & ends at Library mall. you have few shelters for taking rest.

title: The Beautiful Mussorie
review: Its a very nice place to go walking & pedalling . you can enjoy shopping & having light snacks on the benches set adjacent to roads.

title: nice walkway
review: The camel's back road is approx.3 km.walk around the mountain side. It covers the mussoorie mall from the back side.You can see the shape of camel's back from a spot on the walk way & there are people willing to show you more scenic spots there with telescope.It's best to enjoy the walk early mornings when its quieter else there is tourist hotel rush. Starting from back of Green's hotel opp.Inder sweets restaurant leading towards the skating rink on the mall, you will pass by a few hotels, kripalu maharaj ashram, a graveyard, sant nirankari ashram, swayambhu ganeshji murti, hawa ghar (open canopied spot) for mountain view> here you can enjoy maggie, paranthas followed by a horse stable that leads to a small market, finally merging into library side of the mall. It takes about 45 minutes at medium pace to walk that much. You can then take cycle rikshaws to go upto jhoola ghar for a merry go round if you like or simply walk around to nearby tibetan market for discount shopping !

title: amazing place to visit...
review: really i loved to be there ..enjoyed a lot there..superb..nice place to visit after it calls Pahado Ki Rani Mussoorie..mummmmaaaaahhh

title: Nothing great about it.
review: The whole road smelled of horse poo(Library side entry).The smell was so distressing that we dropped the idea of venturing further. The picture palace side was better and bearable and we could see some good views.

title: Good to go here
review: Camel's Back Road is really Camel's Back and is worth to visit. You can feel you are on camel when you pass on the road. There are very good view of valley from the side roads. Don't miss to go Camel's Back Road.

title: a nice place to walk around
review: This is a nice area of Mussoorie and is full of shops.  There is nothing really exciting to do here, just walk around.

title: amazing walk!!!!
review: One fine evening when you move out of your hotel to take a walk all by yourself,camel's back road is the best option! the road is so called as it curves like the hump of a camel. you get to see sky high pine trees, a dilapidated guest house which i wanted to explore but couldn"t. After some time you get to sit on a wooden bench with a picturesque view of mountains all around you. simply awesome experience!!!!

title: amazing walk
review: excellent view to die for. lovely walk of upto 3km. felt so fresh after the walk. lovely experience. even the children were happy as they got to ride the horse for almost 30 min.

title: Not a great place to see.
review: its just a good place to be visited and nothing great to see. if you have time only go otherwise you can skip the place.

title: A great scenic walk!
review: At about 2 km in length the Camel's Back Road offers a leisurely stroll or jog taking you around the mountainside and back to The Mall. Far reaching views all along the way, it gives an insight into what life must have been like when people first settled here. There are viewing and rest points along the road, which is quite flat and not arduous to walk.

title: most terrible
review: waste of time. Next time when we go to mussoorie we never go for camel's back road. dont go for it . it is totally waste of time waste of money

title: You must take a walk to enjoy every bit of Natural Beauty & Freshness of Hills.
review: Liked the Freshness and Cool Breeze,Peaceful Atmosphere and Friendly Locals.

title: Mussorie a Lacklustre hillstation
review: Mussorie is no more the queen of hills. It has dirty streets, an unkept mall area, severely beaten up shops, ransacked by civilization mountains and a dilapidated ropeway opening their arms to tourists. I would blame it to the Uttarkhand government for not keeping the hill station clean and attractive to tourists. Their has to be a proper planning involved in managing a hill station which ahs an onlsoght of several tourists otherwise the hill station looses its charm over the years. Mussoorie has reached that stage. Wish there is more investment done there else soon it will not have any takers from tourist planning their vacations. Nearby Dhanaulti is more pristine and has good hikes, if not anything else. Camel Back road is quite a good concept but it needs to maintained clean and managed well.

title: Peace & calm
review: If you want to take a break from the busy mall road and be with nature, go take a walk on the camel's back road

title: An idyllic hump!
review: It simply is exotic, with the leaves rustling, the road meandering and  birds and flowers all over. The quietude lulls you into wanting to roam about for a long long time!

title: ok
review: Less crowd..bt nice fr couple...can go on hourse back too..less number of shops as compared to mall road..

title: Just walk and walk
review: It is around 4 kms man made walk around the valley. Just walk and enjoy the nature, mountains. There is seating arrangement after 2kms where one can spent time enjoying sun set.

title: Walk with a view
review: When the crowd at Mall road gets to your nerves, just steer off to Camel's back road. It is a scenic and peaceful walk. Evenings are better here. The charm of Mussoorie is still alive here.

title: Crowded
review: The whole road is full of honking cars and Indian (ill-mannered) tourists. There are a lot of bargain shops and ladies would love the road more. So you better avoid it.

title: Scenic and peaceful walk
review: Away from the hustle bustle of mall road, a wall on this road brings u close to nature. There is a lot of horse dung at the start of the walk but soldier on since ahead lie scenic views, peace and quiet. U can also try the piping hot maggi on the way.

title: Lovely & Pleasant
review: Lovely place to walk & feel the nature... It has great views of the valley & mountain on one side of the road.. Superb!!

title: A great walk through histories...landscapes
review: If your are interested to experience the scenic beauty of the great Himalayas or interested to re-experience the historical Mussoorie, you should go for a walk through this road. The road passes through the posh and colonial residential areas of  Mussoorie, with villas and cottages. Every stretch of the road has its history. You also will be able to experience the snow covered Himalayan ranges from the road...perfect for photography. Please don't forget to meet Pradeep Singh with his telescopes to view closely the important points in Mussoories and Landour and the famous stone camel.

title: Highpoint of Mussorrie trip!
review: Loved the 4 km walking stretch, especially the way the road turns and twists and then suddenly one is exposed to the beauty of the Himalayas! You get to see the Gangotri peak on a clear sky day and the view is just awesome. The camel rock is also amazing, one feels that someone has put it together to look like a camel indeed! The walk is just so romantic, makes you feel so peaceful! However, at a stretch currently the MDDA is working on some sewerage restoration and has destroyed a part of the walk, its now filled with dust and potholes and the walk comes to an abrupt dusty muddy end. Hope the walkway is restored soon to its initial and deserving beauty!

title: Peaceful, scenic road
review: Wake up early in the morning and take a walk on Camel's Back Road. Very quiet and scenic, presents a number of photo opportunities for photographers. And you can either stroll or jog, and fill your lungs with the fresh mountain air. A great way to aimlessly spend time while you're on vacation!

title: Nice Views
review: This place is free from traffic. One can have a long walk while watching the natral beauty. This place is very calm & refreshing. This is the second nice place in Mussorie after Lal Tibba.

title: Calm and serene place
review: Calm and serene place amid all happening places around (Mall road). You can take a morning walk and let the mountain air fill you with new energy and freshness.

title: Peaceful Beauty
review: As we have a house on Camel's Back Road (it's just above the graveyard) we have been walking on this road for the past 50 years. One of the nicest places in Mussoorie away from the 'Karol Bagh' style hustle and bustle of the Mall Road. If you like beautiful snow views and a peaceful 1 hour walk this is the place to be.

title: A good walk
review: Good for a morning or evening walk.....  Very few people on the road in the noon time..  the stretch may be around 4 km..   No much traffic in the Camel's back road .... Hence good for a walk

title: Just enjoy the walk on Camel's Back road
review: Just walk with your family along side the road in morning. Happiness of life is relishing the small pleasures.

title: Quiet walk in August
review: It was very nice to walk there, although it was rainy season: the clouds were near us and making funny movements among the trees. Sometimes it was a bit sad to see in the forest plastic bags of rubbish

title: Pleasant easy walk
review: Very quiet short walk (3kms). No noisy traffic and few people using it. Great views across the mountains.

title: Great Quiet Walk with Awesome Mountain Views
review: This is a terrific (level) 3km walk that will get you out of the crowds for a while and treat you to some fabulous mountain views. On a clear day, you'll see snow capped Himalayan peaks!

title: walk of life in mussoorie
review: dear visitors i am recomending you to walk in the camels back road as it is one of the best walks in mussoorie beautiful aglar valley and colonials bungalow .with almost an hour walk pleasent .

title: shopping place
review: good place for shopping but very chilly so please carry warm clothes, especially woollen caps and please dont hesitate in bargaining.

title: not so good
review: The road is adjacent to the Mall Road which promises to give the picturisque view of the himalaya's. We hired a rickshaw to cover the maximum lenght but due to many potholes on the road the ride was not very comfortable.

title: Great place for horse riding & walk specially at evening..
review: We did horse riding & walk at Camel's back road its superb & peaceful road to walk especially at evening time.

title: Serene and mesmerizing
review: This is a quiet road on the other side of mall road. If you are tired of the hawkers and the crowd on mall road, come here for a walk amongst nature and trees.

title: Good for Romantic/Peaceful Walk
review: If you want to spend some time walking away from shops, hawkers and crowd on Mall road you don't have to go too far. This approx 3 Km stretch of road is just behind the mall road. Don't know about the peak season, but in off season you won't find many people on this road which makes it ideal for short romantic/ peaceful walk without getting disturbed by hawkers. Halfway on the road you will find Mussoorie Cemetery established in 1829. This road derives its name from the mountain ranges across the valley facing this road as they resemble the hump of camel.

title: Wonder Walk In The Clouds !!
review: Camels Back Road is good to walk any time of the Day - morning u hv groups which walk daily from years - u wld find fantastic view of the Himalayas - also on the way u wld come across some of the most wonderful estates of the Rich & Famous

title: a favorite with locals and visitors
review: Great for a walk, full of private bungalows....great views of the Himalayas from the path, can be really exhilarating for both the eyes and the senses

title: Life line
review: The camels back road remains the best place in Mussoorie ot probably the only place which is keeping mussoorie alive. The walk is so relaxing that it takes away all the life's worries away.

title: Peace of mind!
review: If some solitude is what you are looking for, or a just a romantic walk, then Camel's Back Road still retains its charm.

title: Great walk
review: It is a nice long walk , away fom all the traffic & crowd. You can stop and rest midway on the nice benchs overlooking the hills.

title: Walk walk walk
review: Camel's back road is a beautiful walk. The air is crisp and fresh and you can keep walking without getting tired. The view is amazing with snow clad mountains in the far background. Greenery, Peace, Relaxation all around!

title: Get away from the traffic
review: This walk is a very pleasant and easy about 3km long. There are some spectacular views and along the way there are rotundas with seats to sit and appreciate the view. The largest rotunda is a great place to stop and have a cup of tea from the kiosk. We never did find the camel back even though we did the walk several times.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: Camel Back road runs virtually parallel to the Mall and is a quiet, peaceful road with outstanding views.

title: Walk away from the horns and crowd on the Mall
review: This is a nice quiet scenic walk along a level road. Ideal for anyone wanting to do some gentle exercise or walk from one end of the Mall to the other avoiding the traffic

title: Ideal for those who like to take long peaceful walk.
review: This road is easily approachable from mall road. You can either take horses or prefer to walk.

title: Just a Cemented Road
review: Nothing is there...........its just a Road for a walk nothing much interesting........So don waste your time to go there if you dont like walking its a long 3 Km stretch

title: Camel's Back Road, Mussoorie
review: Our promenade up and down the Camel's Back Road, Mussoorie is a memorable experience. A man showed us the famous camel rock with the help of a telescope. He also showed us a number of other interesting places in Mussoorie with his binocular. It was a great experience.

title: A nice evening walk experience.
review: With very little traffic it is nice experience for a walk. The views are great. The library side is better for a walk.

title: Excellent walk
review: Calm, quiet walk along winding roads, excellent views, good maggie point on the way. Best for an mid afternoon/evening walk to get away from the rush of Mall road.

title: Nothing Great
review: There is nothing special but a point from where you can see a mountain which looks like a camel with its back facing you. If you have less time you can avoid this point.

title: One of the best places to visit in city
review: Away from mall and rush, it is calm and quite road. Take a walk at evening. Good maggie point on the way. Point from where you can see a mountain which looks like a camel is also very nice.

title: Nice visit in the misty surroundings
review: A peaceful visit for those who want to get away from the hustle bustle of the city! The visit at the fag end of the monsoons was the ideal time to avoid the tourist rush in Mussoorie.

title: its a nice road
review: we did horse riding all up till mall road. its funny how a small rock shape made this place famous..

title: Not worth the time
review: It is basically a place where there are stones, which have naturally taken shape of a Camel. After a lot of imagination and observation you can barely make out that it looks like a camel's hump.

title: Good views
review: Good views of the valley and close enough to walk to. It does have some traffic but not so much as to be a bother.

title: just another road
review: Well, it's just another road, I don't know why people like to visit it. It's a normal mussoorie road. Every road in Mussoorie has snake like turns and Camel like Hump.

title: the most pleasant road
review: whenever i went to mussoorie,i have always been for a pleasant walk on the Camel Back road. The place is very good for some great views of the majestic hills of mussoorie. The road's name is this because the shape of the hills that are opposite camel back road have a shape of camel's hump.The road is long and thin but a morning walk is all you need to recognize the beauty of mussoorie's best road.

title: A Road to Walk upon
review: This road is around couple of Kms but has very refreshing air to breathe, inhale the beauty and replenish the eyes with the greenery all around. Road is free from hustle bustle and shopkeepers and We enjoyed walking on in a rainy night around 8 when whole city could be seen with illuminated lights far far away.

title: Horse Ride At Camel's Back :)
review: A Horse Ride at Camel's Back title might sound a little odd but it's possible in Mussoorie. I took a horse ride in the evening, when the sun was setting and there was a strong breeze. Its was a lovely feeling to hear the sound of the horse shoe echoing in the valley. The stretch is smooth and path is well laid. One can also walk the entire stretch, if you are strong heart-ed. I say Strong Hear ted cause you come across a cemetery which  give you an eerie kind of feeling. Enjoyed my horse ride here.

title: Good looking
review: It is a must for visitors as it resembles camel's back.Nothing to dislike.

title: Long walk
review: Its a good experience for a long walk.The road is advisable to be avoided in case you cannot afford to walk for long as there is no means of transport available on this road.

title: parallel to Mall road but contrasting
review: Its about 3-4 km long road with minimum crowd which connects library end to picture palace end. One can walk leisurely and enjoy the valley view all along. IN the way are some small snacks shops to refresh you. This road is contrastingly different from mall road which is full of shops and people but lesser view points. But mussoorie is such a place that you will enjoy the crowd filled mall road too.

title: Excellent place
review: Excellent place.. very calm, beautiful and romantic. Only place we found in Mussoorie which was not crowded and commercialized. Walking is the best way to enjoy this place. You can enjoy some snacks at a roadside snack point. A must visit for anyone visiting Mussoorie.

title: Go in the winters
review: go for your morning walks. Sunrise excellent during winter time.

title: A walk in the mountains
review: Camel's back road is on the East, hence early morning walk witnessing the sun rise is a feeling of Bliss... At night it becomes scary... When we went there in the evening, there was absolutely no one... the erieness was haunting...

title: just an average road to walk on
review: This is one Road in Mussoorie which starts from the library side right upto the skating rink on the kulri(picture palace) side

title: Nice for a walk
review: Nice for a leisurely walk and trying to spot the camel hump either with the naked eye or with a telesope.

title: Must walk the road...
review: Views are amazing...loved them. Specially it was foggy so we liked it. But one gets tired till the time you reach the end of the raod.. its a little long...

title: The walk down the Camel Back Road is very refreshing.
review: What I disliked was the dug up roads at places probably preparing for the summer season.  Except this everything else was worth it.

title: Superb place to have a walk
review: This road which starts from near the Library Bazar end and goes for about 3 km. ending near Green Restaurant in Kulri Bazar is really ideal for people who love walking in solitude, communing with nature as it has good views including peaks like Banderpoonch, etc. Most of the road is paved with concrete and is neat and clean. A portion near the Kulri bazar side is dug up for sewer/drainage work which should be completed in another month's time. Go for a morning walk when you will have very few people out there.

title: awsome place, with good option of walking,
review: cool, dense forest, valley views, now concrete road,

title: Just another hill side road
review: This was rated as the number 1 attraction on tripadvisor for mussoorie but frankly I don't really know why! It's just another hill side road!

title: Lovely Place
review: A must visit for trekkers and enthusiastic cyclists. Good to visit at any time of the day. Green, calm n quiet peaceful place to unwind and breath in some real fresh air which is missing in all big cities these days.

title: Disaster
review: The road has nothing to offer, no views and hardly any good shops. Don't waste your time trying to visit. Mall road is far better

title: weekend trip
review: nice place for a morning or evening walk, but often too crowded. reasonably clean but too much crowd during holidays makes it dirty

title: Lovely views and a perfect walk
review: Mussoorie in itself is gorgeous, and the camels back road makes it even better. It has some amazing views and the walk is perfect. Take out 2-3 hours and definitely go on a stroll.

title: Amazing View From Here
review: Just Follow the road you'll find the amazing view of Hills. Feeled very relax after walking on the Camel's Back Road

title: follow the road!
review: Easy to walk, no denivelations, and beautiful points of view....Just follow the Camel's Back Road and admire the Himalaya under the snow...

title: Great view. Wonderful walk
review: The Himalayan range in its snowy glory is easily accessible on a clear day. It is a wonderful and peaceful walk from the Mall road which is crowded and touristy.

title: Good walk
review: This road is free of the chaos of Mall Road and one can really enjoy the walk from Greens restaurant to the Library end. It is a good 4 to 5 km of walk so better wear comfortable shoes.

title: Serene
review: The road offers a serene walk. The road offers good view and surroundings. Nevertheless, found it a bit overrated.

title: Nice lovely walk
review: We walked in this road many times just to locate the camel Rock.... We could see each and every hill as the hump of a camel but could not see the entire figure.   Then someone showed us the small rock collection that looked like a camel. It's nice
